title: Cloud developer
description:
Sightic is looking for a Cloud Developer with an understanding of cloud platforms and services. The ideal candidate will have experience in designing, developing, and managing cloud-based applications and infrastructure. Knowledge of cloud service providers, particularly AWS, is essential. An interest in emerging cloud technologies and practices, as well as experience in containerization and serverless architectures, will be highly valued. Join our team to drive innovation and efficiency in our cloud computing initiatives.  



**Main responsibilities**  



* Design, develop, and deploy scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems on the cloud.
* Work closely with development teams to integrate cloud services into applications.
* Ensure security best practices are followed throughout the development lifecycle.
* Automate cloud deployments and configurations.
* Monitor cloud resources and applications to optimize performance and costs.

Stay current with new cloud technologies and advocate for their adoption where appropriate.  
* 

**Qualification requirements**  



* Experience with cloud services.
* Proficiency in development languages such as Python and Go.
* Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
* Knowledge of container orchestration services (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker).
* Understanding of serverless architectures.
* Interest in AI and machine learning technologies.
* Degree in Computer Science or a related field.

  

**What we offer**  



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible working conditions.
* A culture that champions innovation and continuous learning.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

title: Android App Developer
description:
Sightic is seeking an Android App Developer passionate about mobile technologies and driven to innovate. As a key member of our development team, your primary role involves developing and maintaining Android applications, leveraging best practices to ensure high quality and efficiency. Experience in iOS development and an interest in AI and machine learning are advantageous. Join us to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.

**Main responsibilities**  



* Develop high-quality Android apps employing best practices.
* Collaborate on new features with the team.
* Ensure code quality, performance, and responsiveness of applications.
* Explore new technologies to enhance efficiency and innovation.
* Optionally contribute to iOS development, based on experience.

Integrate with cloud services.  
* 

**Qualification requirements**  



* Proficiency in Kotlin and Android SDK.
* Android app development experience, with a strong grasp of best practices.
* Skilled in using debugging tools and performance profiling.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS), databases, and an interest in AI and machine learning.
* (Good to Have) iOS development experience.
* Degree in Computer Science or a related field.

  

**What we offer**  



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible working conditions.
* A culture that champions innovation and continuous learning.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a dynamic organization committed to exceeding customer expectations through collaboration, innovation, and technology. Our tech organization caters to the unique needs of millions of customers, delivering end-to-end solutions for all our brands. As we accelerate digitalization, we seek strong leaders who can bring their best capabilities, innovative ideas, and talented technologists to support the transformative journey of H&M Group.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Frontend Developer with expertise in React to join our dynamic development team. As a Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing the user interface of our web applications using React and related technologies. You will collaborate with our product managers, designers, and backend developers to deliver high-quality, scalable, and user-friendly software solutions. The ideal candidate is passionate about frontend development, has a strong understanding of React principles, and keeps up to date with the latest trends and best practices in frontend development.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Develop user-friendly, responsive web applications using React.js and related frameworks.
* Collaborate with product managers and UI/UX designers to translate requirements and wireframes into high-quality frontend code.
* Implement pixel-perfect designs and ensure consistent visual branding across the application.
* Optimize application performance and user experience by implementing efficient and reusable frontend components.
* Conduct code reviews, identify areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Work closely with backend developers to integrate frontend components with backend APIs and services.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, prioritize, and deliver high-quality software solutions within defined timelines.
* Stay up to date with the latest frontend development trends, tools, and best practices, and share knowledge with the team.
* Troubleshoot and resolve frontend issues, bugs, and performance bottlenecks.
* Write clean, well-documented code and ensure proper version control using Git or other version control systems.


**Requirements:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven work experience as a Frontend Developer, preferably with a focus on React.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript, Typescript, HTML, and CSS.
* Experience with React.js and its core principles.
* Familiarity with popular React libraries and frameworks such as Redux, React Router, or Next.js.
* Understanding of responsive design principles and mobile-first development.
* Knowledge of frontend build tools and module bundlers such as Webpack or Babel.
* Experience with version control systems, preferably Git.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks.
* Experience with backend technologies and RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks such as Jest or React Testing Library.
* Knowledge of UI/UX design principles and ability to work closely with designers.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.


**Additional Information**
 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.
   

  

**Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.** 
**We look forward to receiving your application!**
*H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. As a consultant with us, you'll enjoy a high salary, a generous benefits package, and the opportunity to work remotely. On average, our consultants increase their monthly pay by 44%. How is this possible?
   

  

 The math is simple. We can pay you more because we cut costs on things that don't directly benefit you—no overpaid bosses, no expensive group conferences, and no big fancy offices. Instead, we invest in you, providing the trust and freedom you need to excel and compensating you accordingly. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody means:**
* Maximized Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Higher sense of freedom: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who want.
* Shaping the future: Work with digital game-changers like Mojang, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, and various startups and scale-ups.


**About Us**
 Coody is a dynamic and growing team for the new generation in tech, with assignments in Sweden, Finland, and the UK. Our broad network includes customers in Gaming, AI, XR/VR, EV, MedTech, and FinTech sectors.
   

  

 We think of ourselves as a community platform rather than a traditional company. We are building a seamless existence for our consultants, where trust is high, and micro-management is low. We cherry-picked the functions that actually benefit consultants and are proud to share our benefits stated in our employee handbook.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a consultant in Software Engineering at Coody you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.
   

  

 You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute to areas such as; designing and building robust and scalable applications in cloud environments, working methods, product strategy, technical environment and team spirit.
   

  

 You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


**WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
 Experience building
 **scalable applications** 
 in cloud environments
   

  

**Deep knowledge in at least one programming language,** 
 for example; Java, C#.Net, Golang, TypeScript, JavaScript, Kotlin, Python, Rust, Ruby, Erlang/Elixir
   

  

**A degree** 
 in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
   

  

 If Gravity Free Consulting sounds like the perfect fit for you and your profile matches our needs, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We will respond within a week if your profile aligns with our current requirements.

title: Full Stack Developer - Connected Imaging
description:
We are searching several talented developers in Stockholm or Tromsø!
   

  

 Join our team and your talent could be part of software creation that helps healthcare professionals bring new life safely into the world, contributes to more people living longer and more fully, or makes all the difference in emergencies when every second counts.
   

  

 Our teams empower customers with tools to support their patients and help save lives. We currently have seven business areas that develop specialised software solutions across medical fields and emergency services. At Omda you’ll be close to customer needs and your work will have an impact where it matters most.
   

  

 Our
 ****Connected Imaging****
 business area provides a complete image management solution for securely capturing, storing and sharing medical images.
   

  

 As a
 **full stack developer** 
 you will work with our new product for medical imaging, developing new capturing functionality that will handle integrations with different cameras and other imaging sources. This will be time-critical image and video transmission. You will be using your skills to add functionality as well as designing new applications.
   

  

**Our tech stack:**
* NET / C# / Visual Studio
* Angular
* Windows / Android
* C++


**Your matching strengths for our role:**
* University degree in Software engineering or equivalent
* Experience in C# / .NET or similar
* Web development with Angular or equivalent
* Great communication skills in both English and Swedish or Norwegian
* Teamwork oriented
* Strong “Can-do-attitude”, fearless, proactive, and driven


**Would be great, but not mandatory, if you have:**
* Experience with interfaces to cameras/video equipment
* Experience with C++


***We will start interviewing after the vacation period (mid August), t
 ***herefore we recommend you submit your application as soon as possible.******
***Looking forward to hear from you!***

title: Fullstack JavaScript Career Program, Fall 2024, Stockholm
description:
Are you the next passionated hobby coder dreaming of becoming a Fullstack JavaScript Developer in only 3 months? In that case - you fit the profile! JavaScript and SALT is a knockout combo ☕️🧂
   

  

**The Career Program**
 The SALT career program consists of 3 months intense full time coding (free of charge) and after successfully completing the training, our commercial team will connect you with an external tech team for 12 months as a SALT consultant.
 *Note that the first salary is paid out the month after the employment starts, it is therefore important that you can financially manage during the unpaid months during training.*
 Training start date:
 **September 27th**
**Tell me more!**
 Our career programs are entirely free of charge for motivated individuals who are ready to transform their
 *passion to profession* 
 and launch their career in tech. We believe in accelerated learning guided by our experienced and specialized instructors. This allows our developers to be fully equipped with all the tools to operate in any high-performing development team. Since our launch in 2018, we have conducted trainings in .Net, Java and Javascript and graduated over 700 developers to be placed as consultants at various clients like SJ, Klarna and Trustly. After the consultancy year, 90% of our consultants are then being full-time employed at the company.
   

  

**Do you fit the profile?**
 We are looking for flexible and solution-oriented team players who want to accelerate quickly in their coding career by applying both your technical and soft skills in the consultancy role. What is unique about SALT is that the program allow hobby coders to fast-track a career within development, it is therefore
 *not* 
 required to have previously worked within tech.
   

  

**The requirements to be eligible are:**
* That you have been coding consistently for the last 4 months ≈ 15 hours per week
* You have prior work experience collaborating with others in a team
* Fluency in Swedish, both written and spoken
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken (the teaching language is in English)
* Hold a valid work permit for at least two years from the training start date
* That you are permanently located in or nearby Stockholm (the training is held on-site and can not be conducted remotely)


**APPLY NOW ✏️**
 The application is now
 **open** 
 and we are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis - so don’t procrastinate your dream of becoming a Full Stack Developer! Let's take that coding from
 *passion to profession 🚀*
*SALT is proud to be an equal employer that welcomes individuals of all genders, backgrounds and experiences. Join our team and be part of a company at the forefront of technology, that values and promotes wide diversity in the workplace. There is a profound sense of culture at SALT which is inclusive, open and dynamic.*

description:

 Software Engineer L3

 6 Months with a very good possible extension
 



 Client Bill rate
 



**3200 SEK / day** 
 and it’s negotiable

title: Backend Developer
description:
We are looking for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to join us at NoA Ignite!
   

  

 Here you'll have the opportunity to work with the most interesting minds in the industry on challenging projects with bold customers like Fjällräven & Our Legacy. We leverage emotion, design, and an up-to-date tech stack to shape the future of commerce.
   

  

 NoA Ignite is a place for visionaries, unconventional minds, experienced experts, and change-makers. A place for people that want to fight digital boredom by creating fun, groundbreaking, and ever-changing digital experiences.
   

  

 As a Backend Developer at NoA Ignite, you will be starting an exciting project developed entirely from scratch. You’ll be working closely with a multidisciplinary team that includes frontend developers, strategists, UX/UI designers, and API developers.
   

  

**You Will Also**
* Develop new features and integrations within a serverless architecture on AWS.
* Work primarily with TypeScript and NodeJS.
* Build scalable solutions that can accommodate a large number of users.
* Engage primarily in new development on long term projects
* Collaborate with our multi-disciplinary teams, including developers, designers, and strategists.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to a high standard of code quality.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
* Has at least 4 years of experience in backend development.
* Is proficient in serverless architecture on AWS.
* Has strong skills in TypeScript and NodeJS.
* Is experienced in designing scalable solutions for a high number of users.
* Has experience in designing technical architectures with strong knowledge within domains like cloud, performance, security.
* Is curious, pragmatic, and unpretentious.


**Why join NoA Ignite?**
 At NoA Ignite, we aim to gather the most interesting minds in the industry to shape the future of e-commerce.
   

  

* Technically Brave: With our expertise and playful approach to technology, design, and emotion, we create the digital experiences of tomorrow.
* Authentic Agency in a Strong Network: Here, your ideas matter. Being part of the NoA network gives us access to experts in any field to realize them.
* Top Industry Talent and Bold Clients: Work with the best people and the most interesting minds – colleagues and clients alike.
* A Place for Development: We value working with customers, colleagues, and projects that ignite sparks and foster growth.


**Our Recruitment Process**
 There is no need for a personal letter or CV/resumé; provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and your GitHub or private portfolio and answer a few initial questions – that's it!
   

  

 Next up: we want to get to know you, and you will get the chance to get to know us! In the first interview, we will focus on your personality and motivation for this role. The second interview is about your technical skills and team fit. Before moving to an offer, we will ask for references from previous work experiences. Let's do this!

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
The opportunity ✨
   

  

 Waitwhile works to eliminate the 1 trillion hours that people spend waiting in lines every year. Our platform is trusted by over 10,000 companies worldwide and has helped more than 250 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience at places like IKEA, Louis Vuitton, Costco, Tribeca Film Festival and more.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Solutions Engineer** 
 in Europe to join our mission to eliminate waiting and improve customer journeys. Here's what you can expect:
   

  

* This is a very hands-on, technical role, that is much broader than a typical ticket-based support position. Our Solutions Engineers partner with our customers to tackle the challenging technical issues they face in innovative ways. In this role, you will be directly responsible for helping people integrate Waitwhile into their workflows, innovate new creative solutions and and serve as the bridge between our customers and our product teams in Europe.
* This opportunity is for folks who truly love problem-solving and troubleshooting, with the end goal of empowering our customers’ to reach their objectives and address any challenges with our product. We want people that have an eye for improvement and efficiency, someone who wants to work at a place where they’re encouraged to bring ideas and feedback to the table on how things could be better for both our customers and team.
* This position is based in Stockholm at our beautiful bright offices on Kungsgatan 32. We're an in-person company and prefer that you work from the office at least 2 days per week as we believe the best product gets built together, live.


 What you’ll be doing 🚀
   

  

* Brainstorm with Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, Sales and Support members to conceptualize customer solutions and implement Waitwhile in the most optimal way.
* Debug complex issues with an understanding of both our own codebase and the many technologies employed by our customers
* Solve technical problems for customers on a daily basis via chat, email, video calls or live in-person.
* Build tools that will help increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the Support and Success team
* Influence the direction of the Waitwhile product through daily communication with our customers and consistent collaboration with our product teams
* Create and update technical documentation based on customer interactions and best practices
* Continually research and learn the current and future best practices of using Waitwhile - and stretch our platform to its full potential to support advanced use-cases.
* Respond to advanced product and technical questions, RFPs, and security questionnaires in a precise and timely manner
* Partner with our customers for API integrations and make improvements to our Developer Hub (developers.waitwhile.com) with new guides and tutorials


**What Skills You Need 📖**
* Solid basic knowledge of programming. You don’t have to be an expert in one of the languages we use (JavaScript, Angular, React) but you should be proficient and have an active interest in learning them
* Computer Science degree or 4+ years in an Enterprise Sales Engineering role (or similar) in a SaaS environment.
* Understanding of web technologies and concepts (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, APIs, etc.)
* Solid understanding of APIs and how they can be used for advanced customer workflows and custom integrations
* Confidence in contributing to technical architecture discussions and driving technical decisions
* Communication - comfortably explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers
* Love for talking to and helping customers to solve their problems and make them successful on the Waitwhile platform


 Bonus skills & attributes 🙌
   

  

* You've worked at a Startup or built a SaaS platform
* Experience using a support/ticket platform like Intercom or Zendesk


 A great place to work ❤️
   

  

 We want Waitwhile to be an incredible place to work. We offer great benefits and perks, flexible working hours and lots of interesting challenges. We believe in making work fun and rewarding and care about your development and are committed to your success.
   

  

*Waitwhile has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?*

title: Software developer within fullstack
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you also want to make the world a little better while devoting yourself to cutting-edge technology development? Then Sigma Industry Development is the right company for you.
   

  

 As a software developer within fullstack at Sigma Industry Development, you will:
   

  

  

* Develop Front-end solutions which are cross-browser compatibility in HTML, CSS, JavaScript using frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js
* Create Back-end solutions using server-side scripting languages like Node.js, Python, Ruby, PHP, etc.
* Ensure back-end functionality using SQL or NoSQL (e.g., MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Design and model databases using CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations, including query optimization and database performance tuning
* Deploy, maintain and host servers (e.g., Heroku, AWS, Azure) using different server configurations, API design and application architectures
* Maintain a qualitative version control for source code management
* Use Development Tools such as Development Environments (IDEs), package managers (e.g., npm, pip) and task runners and build tools (e.g., Webpack, Gulp).
* Test and debugg via unit testing and test-driven development, including debugging tools and techniques
* Have a solid knowledge of common security practices and vulnerabilities, but also implementation of secure coding practices


 And remember – besides the unlimited possibilities to engineer cutting-edge technology, you're an addition to our team; you become an integral part of the Sigma family, weaving your unique thread into the intricate tapestry of our company's path forward. Your presence holds the potential to shape our collective journey, infusing it with your skills and perspectives.
   

  

 Welcome to the Sigma family. Your journey starts now, where each line of code etches a mark of your contribution on the canvas of our collective ambition.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
**Education**
* B.Sc. or M.Sc in Computer Science, Information Technology or Computer Engineering


**Know-How**
* Programming Languages - Proficiency in languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Python, Ryby, PHP and others
* Version Control - Using Git and GitHub
* Algorithmic Thinking - Creating efficient algorithms to solve various computational problems
* Software Design Patterns - Understanding and application of common design patterns to create scalable and maintainable code
* Quality Assurance - Skill in defining and conducting unit tests to ensure software quality
* Agile Methodologies - Familiarity with Agile frameworks like Scrum or Kanban for efficient project management


**Linguistics**
* Swedish and English (spoken and written)


**Preferred Additional Skills, Personal Traits And Experience**
 You embody the spirit of a passionate team player, adept at fostering positive interactions through exceptional soft skills. What sets you apart is your unwavering enthusiasm for both professional growth and enjoyment in the process. Just as we do, you believe that learning should be a journey of discovery and excitement.
   

  

 If the realm of AI holds a special place in your interests, consider it an added advantage. We're thrilled at the prospect of delving into the world of artificial intelligence alongside you. Together, we'll nurture and cultivate these skills, turning curiosity into expertise, and evolving with the ever-changing landscape of technology.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 Sigma Industry Development offers you a platform to shape your future. A company where you can excel in your career and simultaneously contribute to the greater good.
   

  

**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – a selection**
* https://starforlife.org/
* https://expectabettertomorrow.com/
* https://www.parasport.se/
* https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council


**Our core values are**
* Family identity – have fun together and show appreciation.
* Teamplay – engage, learn, and give feedback.
* Gender equality & equal treatment – we are all the same: humans.
* Action – act to excel.


**In Addition, Sigma Offers a Range Of Benefits**
* TGL Group Life Insurance
* Cellphone and subscription
* Additional life & accidents insurance
* Occupational Pension scheme
* Parental salary subsidy
* Wellness contribution
* Flexible working hours
* Hybrid workplace


 Apply today if you like to know more about Sigma Industry Development.
   

  

 More information
   

  

 To apply – Register your resume via our website (link in add). The recruitment process is continuously ongoing.
   

  

 For further information please contact, Oscar Silversparf (oscar.silversparf@sigma.se).

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**Senior Java Developer** 




  





**BettingJobs** 
 are working with an exciting B2B iGaming and Poker Platform Provider who have offices based in Stockholm and Manila. They are looking for a Senior Java Developer to join their growing technical team.
 



  





  





 As a Java developer with our client, you will be working in a small & focused team with the latest technology, they are working cloud-based in AWS with Java 21+ and Spring Boot in a service-oriented architecture. You will be working with the newest product, which means to primarily work with new features and functionality where you get to work close to product development and take ownership of technical aspects of both the product and the system architecture.
 



  





  





**The technology stack:** 




  




* Java 21+
* Spring-Boot
* Jersey
* AWS
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* TypeScript
* React
* MySQL
* ActiveMQ
* Redis



  





  





**Requirements:** 




  




* are flexible with an agile mindset.
* like to be challenged in working with different and new technology.
* are communicative, driven and like to take ideas into action.
* can carry a conversation in both Swedish and English.
* are eager to learn and stay current with the latest technologies.



  





 As a developer, we believe that you have worked with Java for some years and with some relevant technologies, e.g. Spring Boot.
 



  





**It’s a big plus if you are experienced in:** 




  




* Frontend technologies (e.g. JavaScript)
* Docker
* AWS
* MySQL

title: Turnpikes söker utvecklare!
description:
Är du passionerad inom IT och söker nya utmaningar? Turnpikes erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans med ett team av engagerade kollegor. Välkommen till ett företag i framkant av teknik och innovation!
 


  

  

  

  


  

**Företag :**
 Turnpikes Sweden Filial
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Turnpikes är en talangfull grupp människor med huvudkontor i Danmark men verksamma över hela världen, som möjliggör digital transformation för företagskunder. Turnpikes värdesätter sina starka relationer, strävar alltid efter att skapa värde och är stolta över sin extremt höga kundnöjdhet från några av världens största företag.
 


  


 Med en ständigt växande kundbas har behovet av ytterligare expansion blivit tydligt. Nu söker vi utvecklare som i en bred roll kommer få ta stort ansvar gentemot den svenska kundbasen. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniska uppgifter relaterade till OpenText Extended ECM (Enterprise Content Management) och leverera kvalitativa konfigurationer till projektteamet som definierar omfattningen och interagerar med slutkunden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En fot in på ett företag vars tillväxtstrategi är ambitiös och där du får utrymme att växa i karriären
  
* Tydliga utvecklingsplaner och en platt struktur som ger dig tillgång till en stor kunskapsbas
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi och branschledande lösningar
  
* Omfattande förmånspaket
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Arbeta med definierade uppgifter i OpenText Extended ECM, som Web Reports, arbetsflöden, arkivhantering, etc.
  
* Leverera hög kvalitet i konfigurationer, utvecklingar och relaterad dokumentation.
  
* Samarbeta i ett större projektteam och kommunicera med dina kollegor på olika platser i världen.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant universitetsutbildning inom IT
  
* Har en god generell teknisk förståelse
  
* Har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
  
* Har grundläggande erfarenhet av databashantering
  
* Kan kommunicera väl på både svenska och engelska
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Här kan du läsa mer om Turnpikes.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stw07@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105555

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
 



  





**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
 



  





**We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration.** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
 



 Our global team, of more than 35 nationalities, have fun together, whether it is during a typical Swedish Fika, a workshop, going for a run with a colleague, or spending time together during the annual company Goal trip, team kickoffs, or after-work socials. We have built a collaborative and friendly atmosphere here at Quinyx and are committed to sharing knowledge and supporting one another!
 



  





 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
 



  





**We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend your local office twice per week.** 




  





**About the role** 




  





 We are building one of the most successful AI-Driven Workforce Management solutions that empowers the workforce in service industries to make people and businesses grow. As an Experienced Frontend Developer, you will join one of our strong cross-functional distributed agile teams. You will be working with other frontend & backend developers, QA engineers, product managers, and designers.
 



  





 At the same time, you will be part of the Frontend Engineering Team which is always striving to use modern technologies, keeping ourselves updated on the news in the frontend community, and aiming to be early adopters of new stable releases. Everyone on the team deeply cares about the overall experience of our application and has a lot of fun while building solutions together.
 



  





 Currently we are in the process of moving our projects into a monorepo powered by TurboRepo that will include a UI library, shared utils, types, base configurations and much more. The UI library is powered by amazing tools such as Chromatic and corresponding GitHub Actions, and also Changeset for streamlining versioning and documentation.
 



  





 We have a lot of interesting new projects on the horizon that will be built inside this repo by consuming components from the UI library, so any experience with these subjects are a big plus.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




  




* Being part of the SaaS B2B product development team, bringing new ideas and designing solutions from beginning to end.
* Working with the latest technologies in frontend and web development such as React, Next.JS, Webpack, vite, rollup, react-hook-form, Jest, React Testing Library, React-Query, TurboRepo, Storybook, Sentry, TypeScript, Chromatic, Changeset and more!
* Developing one of the core Quinyx products, adding new features, and optimizing client-side performance.
* Being part of a culture where we promote learning and growth with code reviews, pair programming, conferences, and workshops where we deep-dive into certain areas of frontend web development as a team to have fun, learn, share knowledge, and experiment together.



  





**What you’ll bring to the team** 




  




* Solid professional experience developing front-end projects with React.
* Ability to mentor and help more junior developers within the team.
* A natural curiosity and desire to improve processes around you.
* A genuine interest in front-end development and best practices.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




  





 We promote and encourage a healthy lifestyle with flexible work hours and the latest tools, enhanced vacation allowance, wellness, home office, professional development contributions, virtual yoga classes, and last but not least, you will have the chance to participate in our well-known yearly ping-pong tournament!
 



  





**Want to join Quinyx?** 




  





 At Quinyx, we provide equal employment opportunities and strive for an inclusive, diverse, value-driven culture. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status.
 



  





**Happy Workforce, Happy Business!**

title: Ruby on Rails Developer
description:
**Company Overview:** 




 Our client offers automated, secure, and sustainable IT solutions, helping businesses streamline operations across HR, IT, Finance, and Management. With 10 outstanding solutions, they aim to reduce administrative tasks, boost productivity, empower employees, and promote sustainable IT practices.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Backend Developer, you will collaborate closely with both frontend and backend teams to enhance the API and core functionality of their platform. You will play a pivotal role in constructing the backbone of the platform using Ruby on Rails, improving the platform's architecture, and refining overall processes and systems. Additionally, you will mentor the development team on best practices, fostering their growth alongside the company. Your contributions will ensure the platform is well-tested and well-architected, providing a solid foundation for future development.
 



  





**Knowledge, Experience & Skills:** 



* 3+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails
* Proven track record of maintaining and improving large code bases
* Experience with writing and maintaining robust test suites



  





  





**Compensation & Benefits:** 



* Base salary up to €70k
* A fast-growing startup on an ambitious mission to digitalise businesses world-wide
* A diverse team of talented and supportive colleagues
* Freedom and flexibility in how and where you work
* Hybrid working model: 2 days in the central Stockholm office.
* Six weeks of paid vacation
* Pension at ITP1 levels
* Generous wellness grant and weekly training sessions with personal trainer
* Private healthcare insurance

title: Solution Developer (Senior Business Analyst)
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 As a Solution Developer at Einride you'll be joining a top talent team of ambitious, creative, kind-hearted people who challenge conventional thinking, think big, and aim for zero emissions.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Develop innovative transport solutions including electric and autonomous vehicles
* Lead planning and execution of strategic transformation studies with key client accounts
* Develop business cases through data-driven analysis, producing a short term action plan and a long term roadmap for our clients’ electrification and autonomy journey
* Work as a thought leader within sustainable transportation and share that knowledge with external and internal stakeholders


 Requirements
   

  

* Proven strategic and analytical capabilities. Track record in e.g. management consulting, investment cases or turnaround initiatives is a large plus
* Strong project management skills and experience in leading junior analyst(s)
* Seasoned communicator who is comfortable to drive dialogues with senior management (e.g. Head of Supply Chain) at large corporations
* Knowledge of Supply Chain Mgmt., Transport/Logistics and/or Operations is a plus
* Hands-on problem-solver with business/entrepreneurial mindset
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (esp. Excel); programming languages (e.g. Python) are a plus
* Fluency in German and English
* Bachelor or Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. Engineering/Industrial Management/Business Administration)


 This position is preferably based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Germany. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Business Developer / Affärsutvecklare
description:
**Vill du verka och utvecklas i ett bolag med en cirkulär affärsmodell som bidrar till ett hållbart samhälle? Då kan denna roll vara något för dig.** 




  





**Om Bolaget** 




  





 Svenska Retursystem, SRS, är
 **det smarta cirkulära systemet** 
 för landets livsmedel. Bolaget finns till för att livsmedelsbranschens flöden av varor ska bli mer effektiva och bättre för miljön.
 



  





 SRS driver och utvecklar branschens gemensamma retursystem för distribution av livsmedel med returlådor och returpallar samt den digitala plattformen Smart Pooling för kontroll av alla typer av lastbärare.​
 



  





 Kunderna finns inom livsmedelsbranschen (dagligvaruhandel, livsmedelsproducenter, grossister, food service etc.). Majoriteten är svenska, men SRS har även kunder spridda runt om i Europa​.
 



  





**Hållbarhet i fokus** 




  





 Med en vision av en hållbar framtid arbetar Svenska Retursystem hållbart i alla dimensioner, i alla beslut och i alla processer i företaget. Grundidén är att branschens distribution ska ske med gemensamma returpallar och returlådor som kan användas om och om igen.
 



  





 Svenska Retursystems smarta, trygga och helt cirkulära system möjliggör att livsmedelsproducenter, grossister, butiker och restauranger kan arbeta tillsammans för att optimera livsmedelsbranschens varuflöden. Alla parter samverkar för att det ska fungera så effektivt som möjligt och tillsammans bidrar de till att minska branschens klimatpåverkan.
 **Affärsmodellen är cirkulär - På riktigt!** 




  





**Ett bolag i tillväxt** 




  





 Svenska Retursystem är ett bolag i kraftig tillväxt. De senaste 5 åren har bolaget vuxit med över 50% och den strategiska 5-årsplanen visar på fortsatt stor tillväxt under de kommande åren.​
 



  





 Tillväxten gynnas av starka underliggande trender som driver på förflyttningen från träpall och engångsemballage i kartong till ett cirkulärt system med återanvändbara plastpallar och plastlådor.​
 



  





**Om Rollen** 




  





 SRS söker nu en senior
 **Affärsutvecklare** 
 med ansvar för att driva och projektleda proaktiva initiativ på i huvudsak strategisk horisont för att förbättra Svenska Retursystems affär och skapa långsiktiga konkurrensfördelar på marknaden. I rollen rapporterar du direkt till CCO.
 



  






 Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 




  





 Driv strategisk utveckling tillsammans med ledningsgrupp
 


* Utveckla Svenska Retursystems strategi och affär samt stötta ledningsgruppen att ta rätt strategiska beslut
* Säkerställa ett effektivt och professionellt samarbete med människor på olika nivåer och delar av organisationen
* Vara en eftertraktad diskussionspartner utifrån kompetens och analytisk styrka



  





 Identifiera och agera på affärsmöjligheter
 


* Ta lead och utforma/leda en process för att identifiera, utveckla och utvärdera affärsmöjligheter samt omvandla insikter till konkreta business case, inkl. ta fram och utveckla beslutsmaterial/underlag till ledande personer i bolaget
* Genomföra analyser som inkluderar kundbehov, marknadsutveckling, branschtrender samt konkurrensanalys
* Identifiera affärssamarbeten för SRS i form av möjliga partnerskap och förvärv som kan stärka marknadspositionen samt säkerställa kontraktsefterlevnad



  





 Projektleda och genomföra strategiska initiativ och processförbättringar
 


* Leda och strukturera tvärfunktionella projekt och utvecklingsinitiativ genom att fånga insikter från exempelvis sidofunktioner som IT
* Planera möten och leda workshops med syfte att säkerställa projektens framsteg, identifiera eventuella hinder och vidta åtgärder för att hålla projektet på rätt spår
* Ta fram och implementera processer genom att väga för- och nackdelar



  





**Förväntningar på rollen:** 




 Kort sikt: ​
 


* Fått en god förståelse för SRS:s kultur, värderingar, affärsmodell och kundbehov
* Identifierat och prioriterat ett antal områden för att förbättra effektivitet, kundupplevelse och/eller minska kostnader kopplat till strategin för att uppnå mål i nyckeltal
* Tagit över och arbetat vidare med redan identifierade projekt



  





 Lång sikt: ​
 


* Framgångsrikt genomfört och slutfört ett antal olika värdeskapande affärsutvecklingsprojekt från start till mål
* Lyckats etablera förtroende med flera nyckelpersoner
* Utarbetat och implementerat en strukturerad process för SRS affärsutvecklingsarbete



  





**Vem du är** 



* Affärsmässig: Förmåga att tänka strategiskt och genom skarp analys bidra till affären
* Kommunikativ: Tydlighet och inkludering gör dig till en inspirerande ledare
* Stabil och förtroendegivande: Du skapar trygghet i din omgivning med välgrundade beslut
* Engagerad & inspirerande: Genom att involvera och motivera driver du andra framåt



  





**Vad du tar med dig** 



* Flera års erfarenhet från affärsutvecklande roller (eller liknande), gärna inom logistiktunga service/teknikleverans-bolag alt. som managementkonsult
* Erfarenhet av att:


1. Driva komplexa affärsutvecklingsprojekt från start till mål
2. Arbeta med business-case, analysera och ta fram lösningar på komplexa affärs- och operativa problem
3. Skapa struktur och jobba i PowerPoint samt bygga och beräkna kalkyler i Excel
4. Driva arbete i strukturerad (projekt) form baserat på tydliga leverabler
5. Hantera en komplex kunddialog och ha erfarenhet av att förhandla



  





**Vad väntar du på?** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan.
 



**Observera** 
 att rekryteringsprocessen pågår under sommarledigheten. Utvärderingsperioden inleds den 5 augusti och avslutas den 30 augusti 2024. Vi uppmuntrar dig att skicka in din ansökan innan dess.
 



  





 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta jasper.sinn@navigio.se
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Innovativa utvecklare till Scania I-Talent 2024
description:
För åttonde gången drar Scania i gång sitt uppskattade I-Talent Program! Detta är programmet för dig med ett stort driv att utvecklas, som gärna bidrar med nya idéer och som vill vara en del i arbetet med att driva omställningen mot en mer hållbar transportindustri! Tar du examen 2024 eller har max ett par års erfarenhet i din IT-karriär är detta för dig!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Södertälje/Hybrid
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 September 2024
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Scania är ett av Sveriges största företag och erbjuder lastbilar och bussar för tunga transporter i kombination med ett bredd produktrelaterat utbud av tjänster. De har målsättningen att driva omställningen till ett hållbart transportsystem genom att utveckla säkra, smarta och energieffektiva transportlösningar som är bättre för både människor och vår planet. De har idag runt 50 000 medarbetare i cirka 100 länder och tillsammans med partners och kunder driver de omställningen mot en mer hållbar transportindustri och är både trendsättare och pionjärer inom elektrifiering och hållbara transportsystem.
 


  


 Tillsammans med flertalet andra I-talents kommer du erbjudas en unik chans att delta i ett program som kommer kickstarta din resa hos Scania. Du anställs i en specifik roll och tillhör ett team men varvar arbetet i din roll med träffar tillsammans med de andra I-talents. Programmet startar varje höst och är utformat för dig som är junior i din karriär och för att du ska få de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna att växa in i din roll. I-talent består, utöver arbete i ditt team, i huvudsak av tre delar - ”Learning your professional role”, ”Go-and-see” och ”Training”. Detta ger även mycket goda möjligheter att bygga ett bra nätverk inom Scania och förutom dina I-talents-kollegor och din närmsta chef tilldelas du även en buddy som kommer att finnas där för dig din första tid. Hos Scania erbjuds du en mångkulturell arbetsmiljö med ambitiösa kollegor och ett företag som satsar på sitt ledarskap. Här finns plats för alla att växa, oavsett om du vill vara generalist, specialist eller ledare. Har du rätt inställning och är motiverad att ta ansvar har du alla möjligheter att utvecklas!
 


  


  

**CI Machine-teamet**



  


 Som en del av detta team tillhör du Scania R&D och välkomnas till ett erfaret, kompetent och framåtsträvande team som jobbar med CI-Machine – en ny funktionalitet som kommer vara avgörande för Scanias ambition att vara marknadsledande när det gäller innovativa lösningar. Målet med CI-Machine är att skapa en automatiserad pipeline – en ”integration-as-a-service-lösning” som möjliggör för designers att bygga, konfigurera och utlösa tester för mjuk- och hårdvara inom hela Scanias modulsystem. Här jobbar du med CI/CD-utveckling i framkant och kommer arbeta fullstack med JAVA, Python och AWS som molnlösning. Med ditt arbete bidrar du i förlängningen till kortare ledtider inom produktionen, förbättrad miljöpåverkan och kostnadseffektivitet inom Scania såväl som Traton Group.
 


  


 Idag består teamet av 10 personer men det finns stora ambitioner att växa framåt, varav vi söker flera i-Talents till just det här teamet. Här välkomnas du till en mångkulturell grupp från hela världen som trivs tillsammans både på och utanför jobbet.
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ditt intresse för såväl tjänsten som Scania som företag. Vi söker efter engagerade och duktiga problemlösare som gärna kommer med nya idéer om hur saker kan förbättras och utvecklas. Det är av stor vikt att du har en god samarbetsförmåga och tar ett stort ansvar för ditt eget lärande. Gör du det finns oändliga möjligheter att utvecklas. Exempelvis har tidigare I-talents nu både ledar- och specialistroller!
 


  

  
* Har en akademisk utbildning inom IT
  
* Har grundläggande kunskaper inom något programmeringsspråk såsom JAVA eller python
  
* Har kunskaper inom eller intresse för att lära dig mer om testning
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i engelska
  
* Meriterande om du även har kunskaper i svenska
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Tester (problemlösning + personlighet)
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work.
  
* Intervju med Scania
  
* Referenser + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrigt information**



  

  
* Start: 1:a september 2024
  
* Omfattning: Heltid, visstidsanställning 6 månader med god chans till förlängning
  
* Placering: Södertälje och med möjlighet till distansjobb några dagar i vecka
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work. Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Läs mer om Scania på deras hemsida!
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Emelie Säfbom eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn05@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105424

title: Developer Relations Engineer
description:
As the publisher of Ubuntu we serve millions of developers, building for the cloud, IoT and data science. We aim to make open source easier and more reliable for innovators and enterprises.
   

  

 We have created a new Developer Relations team to engage directly with open source communities and developer-centric organisations. We hope both to communicate our vision and products for better open source development experiences, and also to have a better feedback loop from those audiences to shape our offerings and priorities.
   

  

 A Developer Relations Engineer is a technical expert, strategist and communicator with deep empathy for developers. This discipline combines practical engineering skills with firm diplomacy across organisational boundaries, in both directions. Like our audience, a Developer Relations Engineer is never satisfied with the status quo, and is driven by an insatiable curiosity to find better ways to get things done. They are problem-solvers and inventors, who understand people's needs and love the way that tools can be adapted to meet them. They stay current with tech trends and provide insights and guidance while fostering innovation.
   

  

**Location** 
 :
 *we are building our initial DevRel team in Europe, Middle East, African and American time zones*
 What your day will look like
   

  

 In a typical day, a developer relations engineer might:
   

  

* take part in team product meetings, at levels from strategy to day-by-day development progress, contributing insight and expertise
* maintain conversations with developer community members wherever they may be found - IRC, social media, product forums, meet-ups and more
* work with colleagues in other teams in the company, as part of efforts to help establish commonality and consistent approaches
* help solve specific technical problems that users or colleagues have identified
* contribute to technical documentation to ensure that developer users' needs are met there
* work on technical articles, presentations or workshops
* identify new opportunities and directions for improvement in the developer experience we provide
* present at conferences, meetups or technical events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

 A strong candidate
   

  

* is a programmer or developer with a demonstrable passion for and engagement in open-source software
* has worked with real-world challenges developing and deploying software using Linux
* has practical hands-on experience of Linux software packaging (including Snaps, debs, charms, rocks, PIP, containers)
* understands current software packing issues and trends in the Linux ecosystem
* has been a contributor to open-source communities, software and documentation
* is an engaging, vivacious speaker and presenter
* can work effectively, tactfully, empathetically and confidently in contexts where different parties have different perspectives, needs and understanding
* builds trust, relationships and confidence
* is willing to travel globally twice a year for company events, as well as to upstream and partner events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* previous experience in a developer advocacy or community role
* in-depth familiarity with Ubuntu and the Canonical ecosystem of products


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Flutter Developer
description:
**Imagine something you can do today that you couldn’t do in the past – like paying for groceries without opening your wallet. At Extenda Retail, we are a dream team of different experts that creates frictionless, game-changing software for major retail and supply chains around the globe. Our innovations touch everyday lives. Join a company that simplifies shopping and inspires retailers and logistics businesses to go further.** 




  





 We are looking for a strong Flutter Developer to join our team! As a Flutter Developer, you will have to have a strong understanding of Flutter and Dart and the mobile platforms.
 



  





 You will perform duties and tasks to support a complete life cycle management (example: Analysis, Technical Requirements, Design, Coding, Testing and implementation of Systems, etc.).
 



  





 You will work closely with the Product and Technical teams across different regions as part of an Agile Team. The role includes research and Continuous Development of new Products and enhancing existing products based on new Technologies. This position collaborates with the operations team routinely and henceforth excellent English communication skills (both written and verbal) are essential.
 



  




* A clean coder who will always leave the code in better shape than they found it.
* A curious person who never stops learning and loves to try new things, even when they don’t succeed on the first try
* A team-oriented developer with the motivation to bring out the best in others
* A person who shares our appreciation for transparency and is willing to share their experience and knowledge for the benefit of the team
* Someone who is willing to take a stand for something they believe in.
* Somebody that takes pride in their work and knows that development is a craftsmanship








**Responsibilities** 




  




* Conducts systems and requirements analysis, creates and contributes to task lists, cost and time analysis
* Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.
* Raises issues as appropriate to support effective resolutions.
* Analyzes specifications and user requirements to perform assigned applications development work.
* Assists with system and component designs to meet requirements.
* Participates and documents design and code reviews to improve quality.
* Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, and documents to develop application software.
* Develops unit tests and unit test plans to deliver quality code.
* Performs testing and fixes to ensure compliance with functional requirements.
* Performs applications maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or IT related field or equivalent work experience
* 2-5 years of experience working across different product domains in a product development/engineering role
* Good communication skills necessary to manage business requests and work with different teams across different locations.



  





**Required** 
 knowledge and Experience
 



  




* Flutter / Dart
* State Management (BloC)
* Android Studio / VS Code
* Android and Google Play Store
* REST API
* Agile Méthodologies (Scrum, TDD, BDD, etc.)
* Strong organizational skills



  





**Desirable** 
 experience of
 



  




* GIT (Bit Bucket, Gitlab, etc.), Jira
* Microservices Architecture, Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development
* Design Patterns and implementing the Design Patterns
* Development of Complex Application and System Architectures
* IOS Development and App Store
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines with for example GitHub Actions.



  





**Come Join the Extenda Retail Family** 




  





 Extenda Retail is on its path to innovation and wants to mash up and create a
 **cloud-based solution** 
 in the Strategic and Portfolio Project Management space and create a platform that will revolutionize the way people manage projects and product portfolios. We are transforming our product and invite you to come be part of our transformation as we enhance our current platform into a world class platform that we will be architecting and building together and deploying the same in
 **GCP Cloud** 
 .
 



  





 In Extenda Retail we
 **embrace agile principles and values** 
 with autonomous empowered teams, rapid release cycles, and a continuous improvement mindset.

title: Android Developer • Tap to Pay
description:
At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we're on the lookout for a creative Android Developer to join our Tap to Pay Team in Stockholm. In this role, you will collaborate with a group of passionate people working on making our Merchants' everyday experience seamless and first-class. If this sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Meet our team**
 Part of our Payment Alliance, Tap to Pay is a cross-functional Team working on an SDK allowing our merchants to make card payments in our apps and partner apps without dedicated card reader device. On a day-to-day basis, you'll be in close contact with other engineers, product managers and designers to co-create a tailored user experience for our merchants and partners.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 In this role, you'll have the opportunity to work with a diverse group of talented individuals dedicated to enhancing our cutomers' daily experiences. Your contributions will be instrumental in developing tailored solutions for our merchants while helping our team be recognized as a catalyst for innovation and excellence in app development.
   

  

 You will be able to collaborate with other teams and Android developers across the whole Android chapter, by code reviews, bouncing ideas or mob programming (we're big fans!)
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Design, implement and maintain features with a high degree of autonomy for Android SDK.
* Take an active part in system design.
* Work on interesting problems together with talented peers in cross-functional agile team.
* Experiment and learn about design, technology and processes.
* Collaborating with other teams and be ready to help our SDK integrators.
* Ensure a high level of quality, usability and maintainability of the (reusable) components and code.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Solid Android development experience and a good knowledge of both Kotlin.
* Hands-on experience with MVI (or Redux) architecture.
* A quality first mindset and the openness to write tests, caring for the overall performance of the product.
* Interested in keeping up to date with the latest technological development.
* A proactive and solution focused approach with a natural willingness to take technical ownership and contribute to the team's decisions.
* A positive and “can-do” attitude with a genuine interest in collaborating closely with your team to build and maintain the Payments SDK.


**Nice to have**
* You have experience with accessibility on Android.
* You have designed and maintained libraries/APIs used by others
* You have experience in working with SDK integrators.
* You have experience with payments transactions in FinTech.


**We believe in you**
 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please
 **don’t hesitate to apply** 
 and / o
 **r let's chat!**
**\_**
 Our Benefits:
   

  

 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

 Who We Are:
   

  

 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

 PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution for more than 20 years. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. For more information, visit paypal.com.
   

  

 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

 As part of PayPal’s commitment to employees’ health and safety, we have established in-office Covid-19 protocols and requirements, based on expert guidance. Depending on location, this might include a Covid-19 vaccination requirement for any employee whose role requires them to work onsite. Employees may request reasonable accommodation based on a medical condition or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.
   

  

 REQ ID R0113209

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Role: Senior Data Engineer** 




**Location: Stockholm** 




**Type: Contract** 




**Note :Onshore/Nearshore/Offshore** 




**Job Description:** 




  
 



**Responsibilities and qualifications:** 




 We believe the role will have the below responsibilities and competences besides the Collibra functionality knowledge.
 



  
 



**Must have:** 




 • AWS Cloud Management: 
 



 • Knowledge of troubleshooting a cloud environment using tools such as Cloud Watch and Cloud Trail. 
 



 • Cloud monitoring skills including, but not limited to, Cloud Watch Insights, Alarms, Security Hub, Trusted Advisor, Cost
 



**• Kubernetes (EKS):** 




 o Monitor and troubleshoot Kubernetes environments to ensure optimal performance and reliability. 
 



 o Maintenance such as updating EKS engine and (re)deploying. 
 



 • Infra o structure as Code (IaC): 
 



 Develop, test, and maintain infrastructure automation scripts using Terraform.
 



 • Networking: 
 



 o Monitor and optimize network performance and troubleshoot connectivity issues
 



**Nice to have:**

  Develop and enforce Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies for user and role-based access control. 
 



  Utilize Key Management Service (KMS) for managing cryptographic keys and ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit. 
 



  Implement and manage SSL/TLS certificates using AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) for secure communications. 
 



  Working knowledge of ETL processes using AWS Glue for data integration and transformation

 •
 **IT Security:**

 • Conduct or initiate regular security assessments, vulnerability scans, and penetration tests.
 



 •

 • AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional level preferred. 
 



 • Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) or Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD). 
 



 • Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or AWS Code Pipeline.

title: Senior Database Developer – (Product Support Team – PostgreSQL) (Bangkok based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 As a member of the Database Development team, you will engage in database design, data management, and database development, all integrated with automated Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. We work in close coordination with product teams, ensuring to offer support and solutions that uphold technical excellence and fulfill business needs.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Design efficient, scalable, and maintainable database architectures, schemas and tables
* Write optimized PostgreSQL queries, SPs and functions to support various requirements
* Conduct database code review to ensure quality, efficiency, and adherence to best practices
* Diagnose and resolve performance issues, including queries, indexing and execution plan analysis
* Transfer and migrate data from various sources to PostgreSQL, ensuring data integrity and optimizing performance
* Collaborate with development teams for seamless database integration
* Utilize automated database CI/CD pipelines to streamline the development process
* Leverage advanced PostgreSQL features to enhance database performance and reliability


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL database development and administration
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field
* Proficient in database design, ER Diagram with advanced knowledge in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions
* Demonstrated expertise in query optimization and analyzing execution plans
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work under pressure to meet deadlines
* Collaborative team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
* Be able to attend on-call rotation


**It’s Great if you have:**
* PostgreSQL certification is a plus
* Experience with GitLab version control systems and containerization with Docker
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
* Familiarity with NoSQL databases and concepts for handling unstructured data


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**
 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #moscow #saintpetersburg #capetown #johannesburg #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #kiev #hcmc #hanoi #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #IT #ENG #4 #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

**It’s Great if you have:**

* Experience with GitLab version control systems and containerization with Docker
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
* Familiarity with NoSQL databases and concepts for handling unstructured data
