title: Solution Engineer - Nordic
description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.
   

  

 When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 5,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
   

  

**Solution Engineer - Nordic**
**Why We Have This Role**
 Our presales organization is a group of highly driven individuals dedicated to closing experience gaps. The Solution Engineer team specializes in working with large, global customers to architect world-class experience management (XM) programs that drive a culture of action and create tangible business value. This person will work on some of our biggest Nordic Enterprise deals and they will be based out of the Stockholm office.
   

  

**How You’ll Find Success**
* Provide presales technical / functional support and solution strategy to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction.
* Provide direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to the customers organization.
* Develop and deliver high quality Qualtrics presentations and product demonstrations.
* Present and articulate advanced product features and benefits, product future direction and overall Qualtrics solutions.
* Design, validate, and present Qualtrics software solutions to include advanced product concepts, future direction, and 3rd party complementary services.
* Effectively consult with management of customer organizations. Participates in sales planning and business development activities.
* Develop and demonstrate moderately complex solutions.
* Architect solutions and prototype solutions for customers.
* Present and articulate Qualtrics product's strengths, relative to competitors.
* Interact with development to enhance/refine Qualtrics products.


**How You’ll Grow**
* Structured promotion process/auto promotion process
* Career Action Planning with Manager
* Qmobility (internal transfers)


**Things You’ll Do**
* Provide exemplary pre-sales technical expertise through technical and product presentations, demonstrations, pilot implementations, and on-going sales consultation
* Cover the Nordic market
* Drive the adoption of Qualtrics solutions within strategic accounts, expanding usage across departments within the business. Translate product/technical features into value drivers.
* Develop and maintain training materials, and deliver training to improve product knowledge and demo abilities of both inside and enterprise salespeople. Build working knowledge of competing products and how to technically sell against them
* Work collaboratively with Product Management, Marketing and Engineering during the development, launch and continuing refinement of existing and new Qualtrics products.
* Respond to initial product requests and frame product issues for discussion and resolution with Product and Engineering teams
* Become an expert in Qualtrics XM Platform and other Qualtrics products
* Develop/maintain technical and business knowledge of industry directions and trends


**What We’re Looking For On Your Resume**
* Minimum of 5 years+ of prior Sales or Technical experience with software in a SaaS/Cloud environment, working with C/VP level buyers
* Experience working with Enterprise-level accounts across different industries
* High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity in entrepreneurial environments.
* Outstanding professional, sales, and technical capabilities; comfortable supporting both enterprise (field) and inside sales teams on targeted accounts
* Ability to explain and resolve common technical aspects of SaaS software, including security, protocols for APIs, SLAs, email/communication specifications, etc.
* Ability to see and present 'the big picture', architect solutions to solve customer problems, and uncover business challenges and develop custom solutions to solve them
* Demonstrated excellent customer facing verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques.
* Possess "best of breed" functional sales experience that could be applied across an entire sales area in general or specific functional categories
* Must be able to pivot to other system related tasks if and when needed. We wear lots of hats here at Qualtrics!
* Previous work in Customer and/or Employee Experience software and systems, including pre or post-sales support
* Travel required (Up to 25%)


**What You Should Know About This Team**
 The Qualtrics Solution Engineering team is known for its collaborative spirit, a strong desire to learn, and, most importantly, to positively impact the lives of our customers. Our mission is to support the sales team and Qualtrics in general in achieving their sales targets by conveying confidence to the customer and demonstrating the value of our technology. No challenge is too small for us, and often creativity is our best tool at work. We are a dynamic team that feels very comfortable in constantly changing environments.
   

  

**Our Team’s Favourite Perks And Benefits**
* Qualtrics Experience Program - A bonus each year for an experience of your choosing
* Worldwide and diverse community that enjoys helping each other
* At Qualtrics we are constantly working to create an environment where everyone feels safe and comfortable coming to work and can, as a result of our culture, make their best possible contribution to our team


**The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model:** 
 Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.
   

  

*Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.*
*Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws:* 
*Family & Medical Leave Act* 
*,* 
*Equal Opportunity Employment* 
*,* 
*Employee Polygraph Protection Act*
*Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.*
*Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind-the-scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.*

title: Senior Project Manager - Execution Lead
description:
**Job ID: 24402 Job Country: Finland; Denmark; Norway; Sweden Job City: [[mfield3]]**




 It’s an exciting time for you to join One Digital organization at Nordea. We are changing Nordea with big ambitions and creating the future of digital banking, and we would like you to be a part of it. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  



**About this opportunity**






  
 







 Welcome to One Digital, the biggest banking platform in the Nordics! You will join an awesome group of people from across the world, that delivers solutions to our customers in a never before seen pace, ensuring that Nordea will become the front-runner in digital banking services. One Digital is responsible for the majority of mass-distributed front-ends, including private netbanks, mobile banks and corporate netbanks as well as API-related development for Nordea customers.
 









  
 









 This position is in Digital Technology Services unit under One Digital. In Digital Technology Services, we carry out various centralized activities for One Digital, such as IT systems decommissioning, disaster recovery, IT change and incident monitoring, IT continuity and Business continuity, application providership, among others. Our unit also drives the activities in
 **Non-Financial Risk Reduction Programme (NFRRP)** 
 for One Digital. And here you, as
 **Senior Project Manager – Execution Lead,** 
 will be playing a key role to ensure that the programme activities are being executed in One Digital by driving / coordinating RRP activities in close collaboration with the Nordea’s central Risk Reduction Programme leads and drivers as well as SMEs in One Digital.
 







  
 







 NFRRP is a Nordea-wide programme that consists multiple different sub-programmes. From One Digital perspective, however, the primary focus will be on 3 programmes:  InfoSec RRP, BCCM RRP and Data Privacy RRP. You can find more information in these programs from Intra.
 







  
 







 In One Digital, we have experts who drive the execution of each different workstreams such as BCCM and InfoSec, and thus, you will be working with them on daily basis.
 







  
 





**What you’ll be doing:**





* Close collaboration with central NFRRP programme people and understand the scope of  each sub-programme and workstreams
* Drive and coordinate the needed activities in One Digital in collaboration with relevant people such as application providers, application owners, service domain tech leads and other SMEs
* Provide the guidance to people for each actions to make sure that the programme activities are being executed
* Track progress of the program execution and provide regular status report for One Digital
* Participate in the periodical meetings with the central NF-RRP people
* Involve in funding discussions with the central programme and oversee the utilization of the received funding in One Digital







 The role is based in [[mfield3]].
   

  



**Who you are**


 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 







* Long IT experience / background. Project Management experience is a clear plus.
* Experience / understanding of RRP at Nordea is a plus but not mandatory.
* Good understanding of IT infrastructure and systems
* Great interpersonal, presentation and collaboration skills as well as driving things further by taking necessary actions
* Mindset towards continuous development of process and ways of working


* Planning / organizing skills and analytical & persistent when working with problems and obstacles
* Master’s / Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or business fields, supported with IT experience
* Fluency in communicating in written and spoken English



  
 





  If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 







**Next steps**








  

  








 Submit your application no later than
 



 31/08/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Ferec Cetin: ferec.cetin@nordea.com. Kindly understand that the responses may be delayed due to holidays.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 










  
 










 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 










  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Backend Developer till Sport och Casino
description:
*Vill du arbeta med utveckling på ett bolag med den senaste tekniken och i ett team där vi har kul på jobbet? Nu finns chansen att få utveckla världens bästa spelupplevelse med oss!* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 



* Arbeta med drift och nyutveckling av våra system
* Möjlighet att arbeta med de främsta teknikerna
* Skapa schyssta spelupplevelser för våra kunder



  





 Till vårt utvecklingsteam inom Sport och Casino söker vi nu en Senior Backend utvecklare. I rollen kommer du att arbeta med både drift och nyutveckling av våra system. För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du värdesätter teamarbete men även eget ansvar. Vidare ser vi att du gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om nya tekniska lösningar eftersom du i denna roll kommer att vara delaktig i att kontinuerligt förbättra teamets utvecklings- och kvalitetsprocesser. Du kommer att vara en del av ett högpresterande team i vår Sport och Casino del där vi har roligt på jobbet. Vi har dagliga möten och samarbetar tvärfunktionellt med andra team inom IT.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas som utvecklare hos oss ser vi att du har högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom systemutveckling. Du har god förståelse för agila processer och värdesätter effektivitet.För att trivas i den här miljön är du en lagspelare som tycker om att samarbeta. Som person är du lyhörd, nyfiken och tycker om utmaningar.
 
 Vidare ser vi att du är prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Vi söker dig med en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska, eftersom stora delar av arbetet är på engelska. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av utveckling inom storföretag i en transaktionsintensiv bransch, som bank- eller finansverksamhet eller spelbolag. Har du kunskaper inom test så är även det meriterande för rollen.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av:
 


* Kotlin
* Java
* GraphQL
* Spring/Spring Boot
* Kubernetes
* OCP4
* AWS
* Test och kvalitet



  





 ”
 **Mitt mål är att bygga hållbara relationer** 
 ”
 



 Grunden i mitt ledarskap vilar på tillit till individen, god kommunikation och styrkan i teamets förmågor. Mitt mål är att bygga hållbara relationer, trygghet och tillit till varandras kompetens. Min uppgift som ledare är att skapa förutsättningar för att alla individer i teamet ska kunna växa och få utmanande uppgifter. Personligen sätter jag högt värde vid individuell nyfikenhet, engagemang, kompetens, humor, och viljan att äga uppgiften och leverera tillsammans. Jag har varit anställd på ATG sedan 2018 och har förmånen att vara Manager IT för Sport och Casino. Kulturen, människorna och balansen mellan jobb och fritid är något jag värdesätter starkt på ATG.
 



**- Rekryterande chef, Eva Rylander, Manager IT Sport and Casino** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och gör bakgrundskontroller för alla roller. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du, beroende på roll, har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Project Manager for HQ - Remote
description:
As a Project Manager, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth execution of strategic projects and initiatives. Working closely with the leadership team, you'll help drive our ambitious goals, coordinating efforts across departments to ensure timely and successful project completion. Your contributions will directly impact our operational efficiency and strategic growth.
   

  

**These are your responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage multiple projects from initiation to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including development, marketing, sales, and customer support to ensure project alignment with business objectives.
* Develop detailed project plans, define scope, set deadlines, and track progress.
* Identify and mitigate potential risks and issues that could impact project success.
* Communicate project status, milestones, and updates to stakeholders and leadership team.
* Facilitate project meetings, document minutes, and follow up on action items.
* Ensure resource availability and allocation, and coordinate with team members to achieve project goals.
* Conduct post-project evaluations to identify areas for improvement and ensure continuous learning and development.


**This is what we expect from you:**
* Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to make decisions under pressure.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.


**This is what we require from you:**
* Proven experience as a Project Manager, preferably within the iGaming, betting, or casino industry.
* Demonstrated ability to manage projects with multiple stakeholders and complex requirements.
* Knowledge of project management methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Scrum, Waterfall).
* Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Jira, Trello, MS Project).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and guide team members.
* Bachelor’s degree in project management, business administration, or a related field; PMP or equivalent certification is a plus.
* Ability to think critically and provide recommendations to improve current processes.
* Flexible and adaptable to changing project requirements and priorities.


**This is why you should choose us:**
* Fully remote
* Competitive salary packages and bonus programs
* Profit sharing
* Career growth and development
* Multicultural team


**Meet Azad – Your manager**
 Hi there, I’m Azad, the CEO of Multiverse and your dedicated manager. As a team player, I believe in recognizing and leveraging individual strengths to delegate tasks effectively. My goal is to act as a mentor, always ready to listen and provide guidance. I take pride in seeing the bigger picture and focusing on optimizing small areas to achieve significant improvements. My approach is to build internal systems and processes that enable our team to overperform without experiencing unhealthy pressure or stress.
   

  

 I tend to be more introverted, yet I always seek solutions and aim to mediate conflicts to maintain harmony. In my free time, I enjoy working out, having played basketball and some football over the years. Nowadays, I focus on gym sessions and yoga. I also make it a point to read and meditate daily to maintain balance in my life.
   

  

 I live in the city with my partner, our son, and our dog. What drives me is the ambition to see how far I can go in building this company without rushing the process.
   

  

**Application Process**
* Submission of Application:


 Interested candidates are required to submit their CV along with a brief statement explaining why they are applying for the role and how they believe their skills and experiences align with the position.
   

  

* Psychometric Testing:


 Shortlisted candidates will be invited to participate in two psychometric tests. These tests are designed to assess various aspects such as cognitive abilities, personality traits, and aptitude relevant to the role.
   

  

* Interview Stage:


 Successful candidates from the psychometric testing stage will proceed to the interview stage. Interviews will be conducted by members of the Multiverse team, including the hiring manager and relevant stakeholders. During the interview, candidates will have the opportunity to discuss their experiences, skills, and motivations in further detail.
   

  

* Final Decision:


 Following the interviews, a final decision will be made regarding the candidate's suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be notified of their offer of employment, and further details regarding onboarding and commencement will be provided.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and embarking on this journey together at Multiverse.

title: Junior Project Manager Internship (English & Swedish)
description:
**Join Adam and Revolutionize the Painting Industry!** 




  





**About Us:** 




 Adam is a fast-growing Czech startup with a mission to provide affordable and straightforward construction and renovation services. Led by founders who previously helped build one of the largest and fastest-growing technology companies in Europe, Adam is already active in more than 10 European countries! Our vision is to expand to more markets, add more trades, and become the next European unicorn. Do you want to be part of it?
 



  





**The Opportunity:** 




 We are looking for a talented and ambitious student to help us launch and build the entire market in Sweden. This is a unique chance to gain hands-on experience in marketing, legal, recruitment, and day-to-day business operations. If you aspire to one day run your own business or manage a large department, Adam is the place for you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Market Launch: Help to build the Swedish market from scratch.
* Support Business Processes: Assist in all of Adam's business processes.
* Trend Response: React quickly to market trends and manage a growing number of orders.
* Strategy Development: Develop and implement new expansion strategies within Sweden.
* Customer Communication: Engage with customers and partners.
* Product Improvement: Continuously improve our product in line with Adam's value proposition.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* Education: Students who have completed at least their 1st year of university. Opportunities for full-time positions for top performers.
* Internship Duration: Minimum of 3 months.
* Language Skills: Excellent written and spoken Swedish and English skills (full professional proficiency). Other languages are a plus but not required.
* Skills: Excellent communication skills, a data-driven analytical mindset, and a hustler's attitude who doesn't stop after facing multiple obstacles.



  





**Why You'll Love It Here:** 



* Compensation: Paid internship for top students, working with a young, talented team.
* Experience: Internship at a startup that has expanded to over 10 countries in the last 6 months.
* Language Skills: Greatly improve your language skills through daily work in Swedish and English.
* Innovative Work: Work on an innovative product transforming traditional industries, with excellent feedback from customers.
* Work Culture: No corporate manners. We believe in having fun at work and expect the same from you!
* Future Opportunities: Prepare for future internships or potentially join us full-time.



  





**Important Info:** 



* Duration: 3-4 months
* Start Date: ASAP
* Location: HQ Office - Prague, Czech Republic



  





**Meet Our Team** 
 :
 


* Check us out on Instagram:
 **@team\_of\_adam**



  





**Read More About Us:** 



* Businessplus
* Forbes
* CC



  





**Interested? Send your resume to us now!**

title: SAP Project Manager (German Speaking)
description:
Our client is upgrading to SAP Hana and needs an IT Project Manager to drive the EAM stream for one of its Business Areas (BA) in Germany. The role involves setting up an organization within the business, gathering requirements, planning the scope to fit the overall timeline (both for the other business country units and the full company plan for all business areas), and setting expectations. The Project Manager will develop the blueprint and run the implementation.
 



  





 The start date is planned for ASAP after the summer vacation period.
 



**Skills:** 



* **Project Management Skills:** 
 Coordination of deliveries across multiple business units. SAP knowledge is preferable; otherwise, a very good Project Manager with IT implementation skills is required.
* **Relevant SAP Modules:** 
 Enterprise Asset Management (including PM, MM, and WCM). Note: SAP configuration is not part of the job role.
* **Requirements Gathering:** 
 Strong ability to gather and document requirements.
* **Driven:** 
 Must be proactive and results-oriented.



  





**Language:** 
 German speaking.
 



**Travel:** 
 Willingness to travel to Germany if not already based there (travel needed infrequently but required for some meetings).
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm

title: Senior Android Engineer, Payments Platform
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Android Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Payments Platform** 
 team within the Payments group to build a world-class payment infrastructure.
   

  

 The Payments group at Wolt consists of multiple teams out of which the Payments Platform team owns the Android, iOS and Web payment modules and UI as well as some end to end payment features such as: Payments SDKs for all platforms and all payment solutions across Wolt consumer app. The team is a mix of frontend and backend engineers who build product features end-to-end both within the team as well as in collaboration with Wolt’s other product and engineering teams (e.g. consumer teams).
   

  

 You would be joining a cross-functional team with a remarkable opportunity to contribute to the team's roadmap, tech choices, ways of working, and, naturally, be able to build all kinds of cool payments-related, user-facing stuff. How cool is that - the stuff you are building will directly impact Wolt’s users’ customers experience. You would be one of the critical persons for developing the Android mobile client’s future, which is quite exciting really!
   

  

 The payments platform team implements various payment solutions for Wolt’s consumer app, as well as ensure that other quickly growing teams at Wolt (i.e. Growth, Retail, etc) can readily use payments based on their needs (i.e. multi-payments, bill-splitting, recurring payments, two-factor authentication on demand, etc).
   

  

 Your contribution can relate to anything from implementing payments library for order checkout as well as integrating new payment methods across all of our 27 countries.
   

  

 As Wolt operates internationally in over 27 countries and over 500 cities 💙 these teams are in a vital spot for enabling a smooth checkout experience for our 38 million registered customers 🌍 and ensuring stable, safe and error proof money flows.
   

  

**What we value:**
 As the business is 24/7 so must our services be. We have a lot of highly challenging engineering topics for seasoned engineers - event-driven, asynchronous service design, blitzscaling business requirements and a strong emphasis on automation.
   

  

**Ownership:** 
 We handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) ourselves in an autonomous manner. Don’t worry, we’re not alone: We have support from central teams when we need help.
   

  

**Technology:** 
 We use modern tools and practices such as modular architecture and GitHub Actions. Experience with Coroutines and Result pattern would be appreciated.
   

  

**Autonomy:** 
 We make the decisions as a team and group of teams! We are free to choose the tools and make architectural decisions together. No top-down decisions!
   

  

**Growth:** 
 There is a lot of room for learning, teaching and growing together. We will support you with the tools and materials you need.
   

  

**Creativity:** 
 We’re building lots of new stuff with minimal technical debt so you can focus on developing new features.
   

  

**Flexibility:** 
 You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.
   

  

**Diversity:** 
 We have different people with different backgrounds. Cultivating diversity and maintaining different opinions is the key to our success.
   

  

**Impact:** 
 Want to see the impact of your work? We're at the heart of the platform and many of our expansion plans per market region are extremely dependent on what payment methods we support. Money makes the business go around
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You might be the one we are looking for if you have several years of experience building apps using
 **modern Android technologies** 
 , our choice of language is
 **Kotlin.** 
 Experience in payments or payment integrations would be highly valued but not mandatory. We commit to a user-centric approach and expect to find someone like-minded.
   

  

 On top of that, we value an attitude of constant improvements and also the ability to create things from scratch. An entrepreneurial mindset of taking ownership of what you've built is a must.
   

  

 So, if you feel that you’ve got what it takes and if working on a cool product in a cool team sounds like something you’d be interested in doing, we’d love to hear from you! 💙
   

  

**Next Steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership of things you care about, and being part of an ambitious group of professionals, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan.
   

  

 You will fit into a truly diverse team across 27 countries - what really matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity. Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring, is on our daily agenda.
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:
   

  

 Anna Janeta, Talent Acquisition Partner - anna.janeta@wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Sales Manager for HQ - Remote
description:
As a Sales Manager at Multiverse, you will play a crucial role in building our sales function from the ground up. Your efforts will directly support our long-term goal of establishing a presence in relevant markets, ensuring our products and services reach new heights.
   

  

 You will be responsible for developing and executing sales strategies, building and leading a sales team, and driving revenue growth. You will work closely with other departments to support their sales efforts and ensure alignment with our overall business objectives.
   

  

**These are your responsibilities:**
* Build, lead, mentor, and motivate the sales team, setting clear performance expectations and fostering a positive work environment.
* Train team members, monitor sales managers' performance and results, and provide coaching and feedback to ensure optimal team productivity and quality of service.
* Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies to achieve organizational goals, with a focus on penetrating relevant markets.
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities, establish relationships with key stakeholders, and negotiate contracts to drive revenue growth.
* Work closely with marketing, product, and customer service teams to ensure cohesive and effective sales efforts across the organization.
* Conduct thorough market research and analysis to identify trends, customer needs, and the competitive landscape in relevant markets.
* Monitor and report on sales performance, providing insights and recommendations to senior management.
* Maintain and strengthen relationships with existing clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.
* Establish and optimize sales processes, tools, and systems to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Review and approve commissions for partners nearing the limit to become partners.
* Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to the sales team and each market.
* Review reports for markets (where there is no country manager yet) with finance and make plans for the future.
* Evaluate markets and decide whether to enter (requires CEO approval).


**This is what we expect from you:**
* Demonstrated success in sales management, preferably within the iGaming or technology sectors.
* Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a sales team towards achieving ambitious targets.
* Proficiency in both written and verbal communication in Spanish and English.
* Ability to develop and implement effective sales strategies and adapt to changing market conditions.
* Track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.
* Commitment to understanding and meeting the needs of customers.


**This is what we require from you:**
* A degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of sales experience, with a minimum of 2 years in a sales management role.
* Proficiency in both Spanish and English.
* Understanding of market dynamics, customer behavior, and regulatory environment.
* Familiarity with CRM software and sales analytics tools.
* Ability to identify and resolve issues quickly and effectively.


**This is why you should choose us:**
* Fully remote
* Competitive salary packages and bonus programs
* Profit sharing
* Career growth and development
* Multicultural team


**Meet Azad - Your CEO and Manager**
 Hi there, I’m Azad, the CEO of Multiverse and your dedicated manager. As a team player, I believe in recognizing and leveraging individual strengths to delegate tasks effectively. My goal is to act as a mentor, always ready to listen and provide guidance. I take pride in seeing the bigger picture and focusing on optimizing small areas to achieve significant improvements. My approach is to build internal systems and processes that enable our team to overperform without experiencing unhealthy pressure or stress.
   

  

 I tend to be more introverted, yet I always seek solutions and aim to mediate conflicts to maintain harmony. In my free time, I enjoy working out, having played basketball and some football over the years. Nowadays, I focus on gym sessions and yoga. I also make it a point to read and meditate daily to maintain balance in my life.
   

  

 I live in the city with my partner, our son, and our dog. What drives me is the ambition to see how far I can go in building this company without rushing the process.
   

  

**Application Process**
* Submission of Application:


 Interested candidates are required to submit their CV along with a brief statement explaining why they are applying for the role and how they believe their skills and experiences align with the position.
   

  

* Psychometric Testing:


 Shortlisted candidates will be invited to participate in two psychometric tests. These tests are designed to assess various aspects such as cognitive abilities, personality traits, and aptitude relevant to the role.
   

  

* Interview Stage:


 Successful candidates from the psychometric testing stage will proceed to the interview stage. Interviews will be conducted by members of the Multiverse team, including the hiring manager and relevant stakeholders. During the interview, candidates will have the opportunity to discuss their experiences, skills, and motivations in further detail.
   

  

* Final Decision:


 Following the interviews, a final decision will be made regarding the candidate's suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be notified of their offer of employment, and further details regarding onboarding and commencement will be provided.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and embarking on this journey together at Multiverse.

title: Product Marketing Manager, Cybersecurity
description:
Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor , control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager with cybersecurity expertise who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future and protecting the digital world!
   

  

 Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* In this global product marketing role reporting to our Director of Product Marketing, you will lead our marketing messaging, positioning, product marketing plan, and GTM execution for one or more of our Security solutions. You will:
* Be a key player on our product marketing team for our Security solutions, supporting solutions including anti-malware, endpoint detection and response (EDR), extended detection & response (XDR), managed detection and response (MDR), email, and cloud application security. You'll be a product expert within the marketing organization for the roadmap, features, functions, use cases, and target users, including the creation and maintenance of a relevant, differentiated, compelling product positioning and messaging framework.
* Be a GTM partner for Product Management counterparts. From them, you'll learn the product business case - including competitive landscape, differentiated technology and capabilities, product roadmap, use cases, and features. With them you'll bring releases to market. And then help build a product marketing plan that proposes and connects all of the sales and marketing activities needed to hit sales goals - and product targets.
* Be a key partner to our marketing campaign leads. You will work closely with the campaign leads as they work on ensuring your product is covered in our various global and regional marketing campaigns. In turn, they will support you with the insights and messaging to use to tune your product messaging and content.
* Develop and execute a marketing plan for your product. Working with marcom and cross-functionally, you'll help build a comprehensive plan that links launches, campaigns, events, and sales plays with content, coverage, and communications channels - offering a single view to everything done to bring the product to market - and then reports back on the results.
* Help with the creation and maintenance of the core product marketing collateral, web, and sales enablement toolset. You will help ensure that all standard assets throughout the funnel are kept up to date, with quality, and following best practices. You will write, author, video, PowerPoint - communicate your product's story in every format, and review other work that carries your messaging.
* Bring market and competitive intelligence, targeting, and segmentation information into your plan, and share it with your Product colleagues. Partnering with our AR lead and our Solution Marketing team, you'll bring insights into the trends in the market, into your messaging and content, and will provide these inputs back into the Product team and across Marketing to inform decisions and strategy.
* Build productive relationships with the sales teams. You'll support their efforts, but you'll also solicit their feedback on sales tools, messaging, and partner/customer pain points and competitors.
* Be a public-facing representative for your product. You will complete technical training and be able to conduct live demos, present your product when called upon, and be ready to engage both partners and customers directly to solicit their feedback and experiences to enrich your knowledge - and their perceptions of Acronis.
* You'll use our processes and tools like Jira and Sharepoint to track your work and collaborate with our team.


**What You Bring (experience & Qualifications)**
* 5+ years of product marketing experience within the B2B IT industry, with time at an established high-tech company.
* Have supported a security solution in areas such as anti-malware, endpoint detection and response (EDR / MDR / XDR), or email security. Experience marketing security products delivered in a SaaS, consumption-based, multi-tenant model.
* Broad IT management technical domain in vulnerability management, cybersecurity, and endpoint management required.
* Knowledge of both provider and business customer SMB through Enterprise IT environments, with specific experience working with MSPs highly desired.
* Ability to dive deep into technology and to convey complex ideas simply and clearly in written and verbal formats, including public speaking, demos, and content development
* Experience working across tech and business teams, representing the voice of the partner and customer, and finding creative ways to engage and get feedback from the customers.
* High energy and enthusiasm – the type that is contagious with its potential.
* Some travel to events and meetings, including to international locations, may be required but is expected to be under 20% and in accordance with company health and safety policies.
* US English fluency with exceptional written, verbal, and presentation creation skills in your native language required


**Who We Are**
 Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. Enhanced by AI technologies and blockchain-based data authentication, this all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete, and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.
   

  

 Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, and top-tier professional sports teams. Acronis products are available through over 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries and 26 languages.
   

  

 Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Handläggare till centralt skolstöd
description:
I Upplands-Bro kommun är vi cirka 2000 medarbetare som arbetar med att ge våra invånare och besökare bästa möjliga service och upplevelse av kommunen. Hos oss är du med och bygger en kommun där helhetssyn, engagemang och professionalitet genomsyrar organisationen och tillsammans arbetar vi med att utföra det gemensamma samhällsuppdraget.
   

  

**Vi söker en handläggare med intresse för frågor som rör förskola och skola och som vill bli en del av utbildningskontorets enhet för administration- och utredning. Hos oss ingår du i utbildningskontorets avdelning för Centralt skolstöd.**
 Inom Upplands-Bro kommuns avdelning Centralt skolstöd ryms tre enheter; Resursenheten, Enheten för modersmål och nyanlända samt Enheten för administration och utredning. Enheten för administration och utredning består av nio personer som utreder, säkerställer och hanterar huvudmannens systematiska kvalitetsarbete tillsammans med avdelningschefer och rektorer. Enheten arbetar med systemhantering, lokalsamordning samt administrativa uppgifter. Arbetet leds av avdelningschefen för Centralt skolstöd.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som handläggare kommer du hantera varierande frågor och uppgifter inom utbildningskontorets huvudmannauppdrag för att vi skall kunna ge det verksamhetsstöd som behövs. I rollen kommer även vissa utredningsuppdrag att ingå. Du kommer tillsammans med utredare vara en viktig del i arbetet med att säkerställa det tillsynsansvar som kommunen har mot fristående förskolor och pedagogisk verksamhet. Du kommer svara på och hantera frågor från medborgare, hantera klagomålsärenden, yttrande till andra myndigheter, hantera överklagande och övrig administration och handläggning.
   

  

 I uppdraget ingår också att vara en del i arbete med att säkerställa att kommunen har ändamålsenliga och effektiva redskap för utredning, analys, planering och uppföljning. Du tar också fram statistik och stödjer avdelningschefer och skolledning när det gäller att ta fram underlag till kvalitetsarbetet exempelvis enkäter och uppföljning av kommunala förskolor, grundskolor, gymnasieskolan samt vuxenutbildningen. Vidare har du ett nära samarbete med övriga inom utbildningskontoret samt kontinuerlig dialog med avdelningschef rörande sakfrågor och systematiskt kvalitetsarbete.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* För rollen relevant högskoleutbildning inom statsvetenskap, utbildning eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Kunskap om förskolans och skolans verksamhetsområde
* Tidigare arbetat med kvalificerat administrativt arbete
* Kunskaper i aktuell lagstiftning och förordningar som rör kommunal verksamhet
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga, såväl skriftlig som muntlig och förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.
* Mycket goda IT-kunskaper. Goda kunskaper i Officepaketet och har god förmåga att sätta dig i nya system och program.
* Arbete från kommunal verksamhet, andra politiskt styrda verksamheter är meriterande.


 Som handläggare tar du stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter, du en flexibel person med mycket god samarbetsförmåga och som kan hålla i många frågor samtidigt. Du har god förmåga att skapa struktur, planera, säkerställa och följa upp ditt arbete. Du har en analytisk och strategisk förmåga som gör att du kan överblicka, prioritera och snabbt sätta dig in i nya områden. Du ser helheten och uppskattar att samarbeta över organisatoriska gränser, du lyssnar, kommunicerar, är noggrann, kan anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter och löser utmaningar på ett konstruktivt och professionellt sätt. Du är serviceinriktad, bra på att knyta kontakter och samarbeta.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder:**
* En kommunikativ och lösningsfokuserad arbetsgrupp.
* En arbetsplats där du kan vara med och planera din arbetsdag och arbetsuppgifter.
* Centralt belägen arbetsplats i Kungsängens centrum, cirka 1 minuters promenad från pendeltåg och bussar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag


**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Lön:** 
 Individuell månadslön.
   

  

 Du söker tjänsten genom att bifoga CV men utan personligt brev. Du besvarar istället våra urvalsfrågor. Välkommen med din ansökan senast 19 juli 2024. Vi kommer genomföra rekryteringen med löpande urval och anställning kan ske innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vi uppmanar därför intresserade att söka så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 I Upplands-Bro strävar vi efter att skapa en skola som är tillgänglig för alla och främjar livslångt lärande med kunskap och studiero i fokus. Vi prioriterar hög kvalitet, likvärdighet och individualiserad utveckling från förskola till gymnasium, och vi arbetar aktivt för att koppla utbildningen till arbetslivets behov. Vårt mål är att ge alla elever de bästa förutsättningarna för en framgångsrik framtid med ökad trygghet och stärkt psykisk hälsa.
   

  

 Upplands-Bro kommun är en av Sveriges mest expansiva kommuner där utveckling står i centrum. Vi välkomnar dig till en arbetsplats där ledorden i vårt arbete och förhållningssätt är Helhetssyn, Engagemang och Professionalitet.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Upplands-Bro | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/159 | Kontakt: Anna Thimgren 08-58169000, | Publicerat: 2024-07-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-07-19

title: Vegetation Artist
description:
**About The Role**
 Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a passionate and creative Vegetation Artist. As a Vegetation Artist, you will be tasked with crafting stunning game environments for our games. You will collaborate in a multidisciplinary team to create art for our world and its components, where we expect you to take your assets from conceptual mockups through modeling, texturing and making the assets performant in the game.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can create realistic landscapes. You should know how to distribute materials and plants and use vegetation assets and ground textures. The ideal candidate should be able to create designs and select assets to achieve the desired result. Furthermore, to thrive within our team at Avalanche, proficiency in technical skills is essential, as is a willingness to learn, engage, and adapt to the engine and custom tools.
   

  

 To be considered for the position you need a comprehensive portfolio showcasing your artistic skills and examples of your work.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Create high-quality vegetation assets such as trees, plants, foliage, and other organic elements.
* Research, collect and interpret reference materials to achieve believable environments.
* Collaborate with artists, designers and other disciplines to understand needs, limitations, and intentions to realize the game's vision.
* Implement and optimize assets for performance and memory usage, while maintaining visual fidelity.
* Help to maintain documentation, and contribute with best practices for the art pipelines and tools.
* Share creative ideas and solutions.
* Provide mentorship and feedback to your peers.


**Who You Are**
* Experience as a Vegetation Artist or similar role in the games industry, with solid modeling, texturing and shader skills.
* Proficient in using 3rd party software such as Autodesk Maya, Substance, Photoshop (or equivalent), and procedural generation tools (e.g., SpeedTree, Houdini).
* Experience with rule-based vegetation and terrain material distribution.
* Capable of taking responsibility throughout the environment art pipeline.
* A good understanding of art fundamentals, such as composition, form, scale, color, texture and lighting.
* A good artistic eye and attention to detail.
* Good problem-solving abilities, both technical and creative.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team.
* Ability to manage your own time and tasks, set realistic goals and meet deadlines.
* Proficient verbal and written skills in English.


**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

title: Senior projektledare till energibranschen
Underhållstekniker – Stockholm
description:
Stadler har byggt tåg i över 80 år. Med vår innovationskraft, flexibilitet och tillförlitlighet är vi idag en ledande tillverkare av järnvägsfordon. Cirka 13 000 anställda arbetar på flera produktions- och konstruktionsanläggningar och över 70 serviceställen i Europa, Nordamerika och Nordafrika.
   

  

 I Sverige utför Stadler Service underhåll, reparationer och moderniseringar av järnvägsfordon. Med schweizisk precision strävar vi efter att leverera högsta kvalitet till den svenska järnvägsindustrin. Över 400 medarbetare arbetar i våra välutrustade verkstäder i Tillberga, nära Västerås, Hagalund, Stockholm och Eskilstuna, som utgör basen för Stadler Service Sverige.
   

  

**HUVUDSAKLIGA ARBETSUPPGIFTER** 
 Stadler arbetar med att underhålla och reparera fordon på Roslagsbanan. Fordonen är av typen X10p och X15p. För fordonen av typ X10p har vi en spännande resa framför oss, med flertalet projekt kopplade till att uppgradera tekniken och förlänga livslängden. För fordonen av typ X15p arbetas det nu med att driftsätta nya fordon levererade från Stadler fordonstillverkaren och att bedriva underhållet på de redan driftsatta fordonen.
   

  

 Som underhållstekniker på Stadler kommer du att ingå i ett team med följande huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utföra felsökning, reparation, underhåll och garantiarbeten på järnvägsfordon.
* Boka och avrapportera arbete och materialåtgång i angivet underhållssystem.
* Dokumentation av genomfört arbete utöver vad som ska rapporteras i systemen.
* Avrapportera (klart) fordon till operatör före driftsättning.
* Identifiera förbättringsområden och rapportera dessa vidare, samt aktivt delta i arbetet med ständiga förbättringar.
* Aktivt deltaga i team-möten och forum för säkerhetsarbete.
* Identifiera och rapportera avvikelser på fordon och processer till teamledare.


 Vi söker medarbetare till följande depåer:
   

  

* Depå Mörby, Vendevägen (Danderyd)
* Depå Molnby, Lindholmsvägen (Vallentuna)


**ÖNSKVÄRDA KVALIFIKATIONER &
   

  

 PERSONLIGA EGENSKAPER**
* Teknisk eftergymnasial utbildning
* Erfarenhet av arbete med underhåll av järnvägsfordon både mekaniskt och elektriskt
* God IT-kompetens och administrativ förmåga
* Självgående och lösningsorienterad
* Noggrann, strukturerad och drivande
* Säkerhetsmedveten
* God kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga
* B-körkort
* Tyska är meriterande


 Krav för rollen:
   

  

* Goda kunskaper inom el och mekanik
* Kunna kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**VAD VI ERBJUDER**
 Vi erbjuder en viktig position i en dynamisk miljö med stor möjlighet att forma din roll där du både får lokala samt globala utvecklingsmöjligheter. Hos oss är du med och gör skillnad på vår utvecklingsresa mot en hållbar framtid. Du får jobba i ett expansivt globalt företag som har stort lokalt mandat i den nordiska järnvägsmarknaden och du kommer tillhöra en grupp av individer med olika bakgrund, kompetenser och infallsvinklar. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor och dessutom trevliga kollegor!
   

  

**Har du frågor om den aktuella rollen** 
 Kontakta Hussain Jan, Underhållschef
   

  

 Mail: Hussain.Jan@stadlerrail.com

title: Senior Software Engineer – Back End (FinTech) (Bangkok based – Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance to cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like virtual credit cards. It ’ s a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In this role, you will not only develop robust backend systems but also architect and maintain scalable data pipelines and storage solutions that support complex data collection, processing, and analysis. Your dual expertise in backend and data engineering will play a crucial role in optimizing our financial technology solutions and driving informed business decisions through reliable data insights.**
**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Think and own the full life cycle of our products, not just a single piece of code – from business requirements, technology selection, coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing, to CI/CD and proper monitoring
* Design, develop and maintain platforms and data pipelines across fintech
* Boost System Performance: build systems that are stable, scalable, and highly performant to meet the dynamic demands of the financial landscape
* Write great code and help others write great code – mentor people in your team and wider
* Collaborate with other teams and departments
* Exceptional problem-solving skills coupled with a strategic mindset are essential. You possess the ability to adapt to new changes and the foresight to anticipate future needs. Leadership at Agoda isn’t just managing tasks but inspiring innovation and driving vision into reality.
* Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration: work with diverse teams to drive forward product and technology goals
* Shape our future team: Play a pivotal role in recruiting and onboarding exceptional talent


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 5+ years of experience with strong proficiency in Java, Kotlin, Scala, or C# with a proven track record of developing high-performance applications in production settings. Insightful experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, real-time processing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark), and advanced knowledge of SQL and data architecture.
* Thinks in systems: their edge cases, failure modes, and life cycles
* Uses a metrics driven approach and can make informed decisions using data
* You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills
* Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Experience with operational excellence and a deep understanding of metrics, alarms and dashboards


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Experience working in a modern FinTech or Payments organization
* Domain knowledge in any of these areas: financial reconciliation, financial reporting, tax, payout methods like virtual credit cards or customer payments
* Hands-on experience working with technologies like Spark for data processing, ETLs for data pipelines and queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Core engineering infrastructure tools like GitLab for source control and Continuous Integration, Kubernetes
* Experience developing, maintaining and debugging large-scale distributed systems
* Experience in leading projects, initiatives and/or teams, with full ownership of the systems involved
