title: Data Analyst at Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA)
description:
**Job ID: 24580** 






  
 





**About Us** 






  
 





 At Nordea, we are dedicated to making a positive change in the world by building the next-generation platform to prevent money from flowing into illegal activities such as terrorist financing, corruption, drug smuggling, tax evasion, and human trafficking. We are seeking talented individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to combat financial crime and drive meaningful impact.
 





  
 




**About this opportunity**





  
 





 As a Data Analyst within the data science unit of Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA) at Nordea, you will play a crucial role in aiding cross-jurisdictional special investigations and coordinating operational and strategic intelligence through the analysis of data. You will leverage your expertise in data interpretation, visualization, and statistical analysis to turn data into actionable insights.
 





  
 





**Key Responsibilities:** 





* Collect, clean, and analyse large datasets to identify patterns and trends related to financial crime.
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using visualization technologies such as Qlik Sense, Power BI, or similar tools to monitor key performance indicators and detect suspicious behaviour.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
* Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present findings to support decision-making processes.
* Demonstrate the ability to think on your feet, adapting quickly to changing circumstances and requirements.
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and testing.




**Who you are**





  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 





**Requirements:** 





* Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within the financial services industry or related fields.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, or a related field.
* Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
* Clear communication skills to convey complex findings to stakeholders.
* Experience with visualization technologies such as Qlik Sense, Power BI, or similar tools.
* Fluency in English.
* Experience working with Cloud Technologies is a plus.





**How to Apply** 






  
 





 If you are passionate about leveraging data to prevent financial crime and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we want to hear from you! Please submit your application detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining Nordea's Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics unit.
 





  
 





 Make your mark on something bigger at Nordea! Join us today.
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 21/07/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Aleksander Tsvetanov Kitov.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. 
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden only -** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Lead Consultant
description:
Join our dynamic Infrastructure & Operations team as a Lead Consultant/Business Relationship Manager. This role is pivotal in bridging the gap between IT and business stakeholders, ensuring that IT services align with the needs and objectives of the organization. With a blend of eye for business, technical expertise, and exceptional communication skills, you will be instrumental in driving our mission forward.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Lead Consultant, your responsibilities will span across Business Relationship Management, Service Management, Technical Cross-Technology Skills, Communication and Collaboration, and Standards & Compliance. You will act as the main liaison between the IT organization and business team members and lead all aspects of the end-to-end delivery of IT services. The role holder needs to possess a deep understanding of a broad range of enterprise technologies, facilitate regular meetings with stakeholders and IT teams, and ensure compliance with standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR, HIPAA.
   

  

**Essential Skills/Experience:**
* ITIL certification or equivalent experience in service management best practices
* Proven experience in business relationship management, service management, and technical leadership
* Technical Certifications – any of the Infrastructure technologies
* Superb communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and effectively manage competing priorities
* 12+ years of experience
* In-depth understanding of compliance standards and regulations such as ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR, HIPAA
* Experience in Risk Management


**Desirable skills/experience:**
* Deep understanding of cloud computing, networking, cybersecurity, and enterprise applications.
* Cross' technology e2e thinking
* Experience in driving innovation and process improvement in service delivery.
* Project management certification or equivalent experience.
* Experience in a regulated industry such as healthcare


 When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.
   

  

**Why AstraZeneca?**
 At AstraZeneca, we are committed to disrupting an industry and changing lives. Our work has a direct impact on patients. We combine cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data. We dare to lead, applying our problem-solving mindset to identify and tackle opportunities across the whole enterprise. We're part of a global company that's investing in a bold digital strategy; to become a truly data-led enterprise that disrupts the entire industry. With investment behind us, there's no slowing us down. There's no better place to make a big impact.
   

  

 Ready to make a difference? Apply today!
   

  

 We welcome your application, no later than
 **July 16th.**

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, A&D and RF Power EMEA
description:
**Company Overview:**
 MACOM designs and manufactures semiconductor products for Data Center, Telecommunication and Industrial and Defense applications. Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM has design centers and sales offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia. MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard.
   

  

 MACOM has more than 65 years of application expertise with multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. Click here to view our facilities. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business.
   

  

 MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.
   

  

 MACOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce. MACOM will not discriminate against any worker or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military obligations, or membership in any other category protected under applicable law.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Looking for a self-motivated and visionary senior product marketing manager with extensive experience in the Aerospace, Defense and Industrial markets in the EMEA region and high-power RF semiconductor. In this key position, you will be joining the RF Power business unit as a member of the product management team and responsible for managing the rapidly growing portfolio of GaN based high-power RF products with focus on the Aerospace and Defense market segment
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop market segment strategy and product roadmaps
* New product definition and business case generation
* Active participation in the NPD process as the voice of the customer
* Product positioning in the marketplace and go to market activities
* Establish pricing strategy and negotiate contracts
* Identify opportunities, drive the design win process, and manage customer business for the Aerospace and Defense market
* Manage existing business/customers and drive new business opportunities for potential revenue growth for the business unit
* Manage assigned domestic and international accounts by providing directly or through the sales channel, new product information and roadmap material, sampling support, customer-specific specifications, expediting, and factory and quality support
* Work with product development engineering, applications engineering, manufacturing and sales to develop new products or enhance existing products


**Required Qualifications:**
* B.S. (EE) or Equivalent
* 10 + years of experience as a product manager (or equivalent) in the aerospace and defense market, with 5 years or more of this experience in managing RF power components.
* Strong understanding of aerospace and defense systems and power amplifier requirements
* Experience with new product launch and business development
* Ability to prepare professional marketing material for customer and internal communications.
* Price and opportunity negotiation skills.
* Willingness to travel, including domestic and international


**Desired Qualifications:**
* MBA, or equivalent, business management qualifications

title: Dynamics 365 Specialist - CE/F&SCM (Alla kontor)
description:
*Engage Group befinner sig på en snabb tillväxtresa och vi letar nu efter Dynamics 365-specialister som vill ansluta sig till ett erfaret team av experter, MVP:er och Fast Track-arkitekter som är stolta över att leverera exceptionell kvalitet och affärsvärde till våra kunder.* 




  
 



 Anslut dig till vårt team och bli en del i stora internationella projekt där du spelar en central roll i att utforma och implementera lösningar för våra kunder. Engage Group ger dig möjligheten att driva innovation genom leverans av Dynamics 365, vilket positionerar dig i teknikens framkant. Genom nära samarbete med Microsofts produktteam, övervakat av vårt ansedda MVP och Fast Track Architect-team, kommer du att vara instrumentell i att designa moderna lösningar. Du kommer att delta i olika projekt och uppdrag som sträcker sig över olika branscher och marknadssegment och utveckla en gedigen karriär inom Dynamics 365 tillsammans med erfarna chefer och kollegor. Som en del av vårt åtagande och engagemang för din tillväxt erbjuder vi ett mentorskapsprogram som är utformat för att underlätta din utveckling från stream lead till arkitekt eller branschexpert inom retail, manufacturing eller profesionall services.
 



  
 



 Är du angelägen om att trivas i en miljö som främjar både personlig och professionell utveckling, är denna möjlighet rätt för dig.
 



  
 



**Vem du är:** 




 Du är positiv, engagerad, lätt att samarbeta med och har en kundcentrerad inställning. Du lägger stor vikt vid att förstå klientens processer, arbetssätt och utmaningar för att designa den bästa möjliga lösningen. Du har en stark drivkraft att ständigt söka ny kunskap om relevanta produkter, lösningar, teknologier och branscher. Dessutom är du ödmjuk, gillar att tänka i processer, triggas av problemlösning och att leverera kvalitet.
 



  
 



**Erfarenhet och kompetens:** 



* +5 års erfarenhet av ERP och/eller CRM implementationer
* Erfarenhet av fullskaliga end-to-end Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM och/eller CE implementationer
* Omfattande kompetens inom Power Platform och/eller Azure
* Facilitering av workshops och kravinsamling
* Flytande i svenska och engelska



  
 



**Ytterligare kvalifikationer:** 



* Erfarenhet inom retail och/eller manufacturing
* Agila principer och Azure DevOps



  
 



**Om Engage:** 




 Engage är ett expertkonsultföretag inom Microsoft Dynamics. Våra medarbetare är branschledande specialister inom Dynamics-ekosystemet och är enbart fokuserade på toppmoderna lösningar för Dynamics-miljön. De flesta av våra kunder är baserade i Sverige men har en global närvaro och vår verksamhet är internationell.
 



  
 



 Vi har 80+ anställda på kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Kalmar och Jönköping. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Stockholm och vi erbjuder hybrida arbetsvillkor. Engage har en långsiktig tillväxtplan och du kommer att bli en del av ett företag som växer snabbt på en mycket intressant marknad.
 



  
 



**Ansökan:** 




 Vi ser fram emot att arbeta med dig. Känner du likadant för oss? Skicka in din ansökan nu!
 



 Vill du veta mer om oss, vår arbetskultur och vårt team?
 



  
 



 Du hittar mer information här: www.engagenow.com/ eller kontakta oss via e-mail på contact@engagenow.com.

title: Senior Product Manager, AI/ML I Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a passionate and creative Senior Product Manager interested in pushing our understanding and value of AI powered Level Automation and personalization in the game. With over 17,000 levels (and counting!), you will have a very exciting opportunity at your hands! You would join the Kingdom at a very exciting time and will get the opportunity to be part of an excellent team, where we innovate on industry leading and genre defining games with over 200 million active players!
   

  

**Your role within the Kingdom**
 As a Senior Product Manager focusing on AI Level Automation, you will be part of the Candy Crush Core Gameplay team. You will be working in a cross-functional team in a lively, dynamic and fast-paced environment, where you’ll own the Level Automation strategy. You will enable execution and drive business impact by creating meaningful and relevant experiences to delight our players and grow our business.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

* Drive the product strategy and roadmap for AI powered Level Automation, working closely with Data Scientists, Engineers, Level Designers, and other cross-functional colleagues
* Drive the implementation and execution of the product strategy, ensuring effective collaborative working models across teams, ensuring a high level of delivery and value along the way
* Articulate success metrics and business impact of AI/ML initiatives, as well as setting goals for teams
* Build a great team environment, coordinating and aligning your cross- functional team(s) towards our goals
* Drive effective x-org collaboration and ensure our requirements as internal customers are prioritized and met
* Define and evaluate key results and performance metrics that inform the success of our products and features.
* Use analytics and quantitative analysis to monitor game performance, recommend optimizations, and provide input for interventions to increase user retention, engagement, and monetization.
* Provide stakeholders with regular or ad-hoc updates on the progress and performance of the personalization efforts


**Skills To Create Thrills**
* Extensive experience in a product leadership or product management role at a tech/games company
* Proven hands-on experience working with AI/ML applications where you have realized business impact
* Experience in enabling and scaling a business from an AI/ML perspective
* Experience with very short implementation cycles such as digital products, services, or games
* An analytical mindset, with an excellent understanding of data and statistics and the ability to interpret data with confidence and make recommendations
* Experience working with creative crafts, such as design and art, as well engineers - aligning everyone towards the same goal
* An excellent communicator with experience managing a variety of different stakeholders
* Curiosity and willingness to learn new skills


**About King**
 At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Psychometrician, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Is translating educational theories into actionable assessments your superpower? Do you thrive in environments where excellence is the norm, dissecting and designing with a level of precision that only the keenest eye can achieve?
   

  

 We're scouting for an expert in psychometrics with a flair for distilling complex educational measurements into clear, effective tests to sculpt revolutionary educational experiences. Think you have checked all the right boxes so far? Then this is your opportunity to shine.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we're not just tinkering with the idea of AI in education; we're orchestrating a full-blown transformation. Scrap the old playbook of manual test creation. Textbooks? Obsolete. In this role, you will wield the power of generative AI to design prompts that delve deep into the subject matter, commanding it to produce test content that's personalized, engaging, and rigorous.
   

  

 Your experience in quantitative measurement and educational content creation will help you synthesize complex frameworks into AI prompts, yielding razor-sharp test questions that align tightly with educational standards. You will then quality control your outputs by crafting AI-first rubrics, ensuring each question and answer hits the mark and stimulates curiosity, enriching the learning journey. It's all about a relentless pursuit of excellence, a continuous cycle of refinement, and a dedication to content that not only meets but exceeds the bar.
   

  

 If you're seeking a role where you can blend creativity with technology and where your contributions have a lasting impact, Trilogy is where you belong. Take the leap and apply now!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Creating and refining test content to meet rigorous educational standards, using a blend of psychometrics and generative AI tools
* Developing assessment rubrics with the help of AI that evaluate the depth, alignment, and educational impact of the test content
* Enhancing the quality of test content through a streamlined, iterative process for consistently superior and challenging assessments


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Creating test content manually – you will be using generative AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude etc.) for every task
* Developing code to automate systems - you will focus on test design using AI, while our engineers handle the tech specifics


**Psychometrician Key Responsibilities**
 Applying your psychometric expertise to develop and refine test content with the help of AI, ensuring the assessments are personalized, rigorous, and aligned with educational standards
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree or higher with a focus on psychometrics, educational measurement and statistics, OR at least 3 years of experience creating content for standardized tests (SAT, ACT, etc.) within an edtech environment
* Basic familiarity with and an eagerness to rapidly master AI tools and their application in test content development
* A user-centric approach and the ability to critically evaluate content in terms of appropriateness, accuracy, and relevance


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5159-SE-Stockhol-Psychometricia

title: Client Director
description:
**Client Director till Carat!** 




 Vill du jobba på Sveriges ledande mediebyrå med marknadens finaste kunder och de vassaste kollegorna? Lockas du av att vara en del av Dentsu, ett globalt kommunikationsnätverk som skapar lösningar i världsklass? Har du stort kundfokus, exceptionellt driv och passion för kommunikation och media? Då kan detta vara något för dig. Vi växer och söker en ny kollega till en av våra största kunder.
 



  





**Rollen som Client Director** 




 Som Client Director på Carat ansvarar du för att driva större kunduppdrag och hela teamet runt kunden. Du leder affärsstrategiska projekt och utvecklar kunduppdrag genom nya idéer som driver kundens affär framåt. Du har ansvar för budgetering, avtal och kundens lönsamhet samt att möta och identifiera kundens behov. Du arbetar fram tydliga affärsutvecklingsplaner och kundserviceplaner för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i leveranserna.
 



  





 Du projektleder team av mediespecialister, projektledare och konsulter inom Dentsu för att möta kundens behov genom hela kundresan. Du utvecklar insiktsdrivna kommunikationsstrategier med tillväxtfokus, medieprinciper och budgetfördelning samt arbetar aktivt med idégenerering och kreativitet. Att bygga starka relationer med Carats kunder, partners, leverantörer, reklambyråer och kollegor inom Dentsu är en central del av rollen. Du deltar även i pitchprocesser, vilket är en naturlig del av ditt arbete.
 



  





**Dina erfarenheter:** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet av strategiska uppdrag, med stort intresse för marknadskommunikation. Gärna från motsvarande roll.
* Holistisk syn på kommunikation och förståelse för medias roll oavsett om det är köpt, ägt eller förtjänat.
* Erfarenhet från arbete på mediebyrå, konsultbolag eller annan byrå är meriterande.
* Van presentatör med hög social kompetens.
* Kunskap om relevanta branschverktyg och Office-paketet, med nyfikenhet för AI och dess möjligheter.



  





**Du är/har:** 



* Positiv, nyfiken och utåtriktad med intresse för ny teknik och innovationer.
* Säljorienterad och drivs av tydliga mål för både dig och kund
* Bekväm med att prata och skriva på engelska.
* Ser möjligheter i utmaningar
* Förmåga att analysera siffror och dra tydliga slutsatser för att skapa innovativa strategiska planer.
* Vill vara med och påverka kunders tillväxt med intresse för affärsutveckling



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* En unik utvecklingsmiljö och Sveriges bästa kundlista.
* Tillgång till vårt internationella nätverk för inspiration och vidareutbildning.
* Samarbete med Sveriges bästa kundteam och en oslagbar samling av Sveriges största annonsörer



  





**Om Carat & Dentsu** 




 Carat ingår i Dentsu Sweden som är del i ett globalt kommunikationsnätverk med 47.000 medarbetare i fler än 145 länder. Vi erbjuder våra medarbetare möjligheten att jobba med flera marknadsledande varumärken och spännande kunder. Våra samtliga svenska bolag är miljödiplomerade enligt Svensk Miljöbas och vi jobbar aktivt med vårt sociala och miljömässiga ansvarstagande som arbetsgivare och medmänniskor. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion är djupt förankrat i våra gemensamma värderingar - the 8 Ways to Never Before – och vårt Leadership Framework är applicerbart på alla våra medarbetare. Vi är stolta över det som gör oss unika som företag och individer och vi uppmuntrar sökande från alla olika typer av bakgrunder att söka sig till oss.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder bland annat:** 



* Kollektivavtal
* 5000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 dagars semesterrätt
* Flexibilitet och den bästa möjliga mixen av två goda ting, att jobba på våra kontor och att jobba hemma
* Många karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter



  





**Ansökan och kontakt** 




 Låter det här som något för dig? Om du kan se dig själv i rollen som Client Director på Carat och som en del av dentsu-nätverket, vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan – vi är nyfikna på dig och vad just du kan bidra med! Vi kommer att påbörja urvalsprocessen, men på grund av sommar och ledigheter kommer aktiv selektering att ske i augusti. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



  





**Vid frågor, kontakta:** 




  





 Maria K., Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
 



 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com.
 



  





 Madeleine Jarehov, Managing Director Carat
 



 madeleine.jarehov@carat.com

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Senior Product Marketing Manager key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-SeniorProductM.001

title: Back End Developer
description:
We are looking for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to join us at NoA Ignite!
 



  





 Here you'll have the opportunity to work with the most interesting minds in the industry on challenging projects with bold customers like Fjällräven & Our Legacy. We leverage emotion, design, and an up-to-date tech stack to shape the future of commerce.
 



 NoA Ignite is a place for visionaries, unconventional minds, experienced experts, and change-makers. A place for people that want to fight digital boredom by creating fun, groundbreaking, and ever-changing digital experiences.
 



  





 As a Backend Developer at NoA Ignite, you will be starting an exciting project developed entirely from scratch. You’ll be working closely with a multidisciplinary team that includes frontend developers, strategists, UX/UI designers, and API developers.
 



  





**You will also:** 



* Develop new features and integrations within a serverless architecture on AWS.
* Work primarily with TypeScript and NodeJS.
* Build scalable solutions that can accommodate a large number of users.
* Engage primarily in new development on long term projects
* Collaborate with our multi-disciplinary teams, including developers, designers, and strategists.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to a high standard of code quality.



  





**We are looking for someone who:** 



* Has at least 4 years of experience in backend development.
* Is proficient in serverless architecture on AWS.
* Has strong skills in TypeScript and NodeJS.
* Is experienced in designing scalable solutions for a high number of users.
* Has experience in designing technical architectures with strong knowledge within domains like cloud, performance, security.
* Is curious, pragmatic, and unpretentious.



  





**Why join NoA Ignite?** 




 At NoA Ignite, we aim to gather the most interesting minds in the industry to shape the future of e-commerce.
 



  





 - Technically Brave: With our expertise and playful approach to technology, design, and emotion, we create the digital experiences of tomorrow.
 



 - Authentic Agency in a Strong Network: Here, your ideas matter. Being part of the NoA network gives us access to experts in any field to realize them.
 



 - Top Industry Talent and Bold Clients: Work with the best people and the most interesting minds – colleagues and clients alike.
 



 - A Place for Development: We value working with customers, colleagues, and projects that ignite sparks and foster growth.
 



  





**Our Recruitment Process** 




 There is no need for a personal letter or CV/resumé; provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and your GitHub or private portfolio and answer a few initial questions – that's it!
 



 Next up: we want to get to know you, and you will get the chance to get to know us! In the first interview, we will focus on your personality and motivation for this role. The second interview is about your technical skills and team fit. Before moving to an offer, we will ask for references from previous work experiences. Let's do this!

title: Client Director
description:
**Job Title:**
 Client Director
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Client Director till Carat!**
 Vill du jobba på Sveriges ledande mediebyrå med marknadens finaste kunder och de vassaste kollegorna? Lockas du av att vara en del av Dentsu, ett globalt kommunikationsnätverk som skapar lösningar i världsklass? Har du stort kundfokus, exceptionellt driv och passion för kommunikation och media? Då kan detta vara något för dig. Vi växer och söker en ny kollega till en av våra största kunder.
   

  

**Rollen som Client Director**
 Som Client Director på Carat ansvarar du för att driva större kunduppdrag och hela teamet runt kunden. Du leder affärsstrategiska projekt och utvecklar kunduppdrag genom nya idéer som driver kundens affär framåt. Du har ansvar för budgetering, avtal och kundens lönsamhet samt att möta och identifiera kundens behov. Du arbetar fram tydliga affärsutvecklingsplaner och kundserviceplaner för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i leveranserna.
   

  

 Du projektleder team av mediespecialister, projektledare och konsulter inom Dentsu för att möta kundens behov genom hela kundresan. Du utvecklar insiktsdrivna kommunikationsstrategier med tillväxtfokus, medieprinciper och budgetfördelning samt arbetar aktivt med idégenerering och kreativitet. Att bygga starka relationer med Carats kunder, partners, leverantörer, reklambyråer och kollegor inom Dentsu är en central del av rollen. Du deltar även i pitchprocesser, vilket är en naturlig del av ditt arbete.
   

  

**Dina erfarenheter:**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av strategiska uppdrag, med stort intresse för marknadskommunikation. Gärna från motsvarande roll.
* Holistisk syn på kommunikation och förståelse för medias roll oavsett om det är köpt, ägt eller förtjänat.
* Erfarenhet från arbete på mediebyrå, konsultbolag eller annan byrå är meriterande.
* Van presentatör med hög social kompetens.
* Kunskap om relevanta branschverktyg och Office-paketet, med nyfikenhet för AI och dess möjligheter.


**Du är/har:**
* Positiv, nyfiken och utåtriktad med intresse för ny teknik och innovationer.
* Säljorienterad och drivs av tydliga mål för både dig och kund
* Bekväm med att prata och skriva på engelska.
* Ser möjligheter i utmaningar
* Förmåga att analysera siffror och dra tydliga slutsatser för att skapa innovativa strategiska planer.
* Vill vara med och påverka kunders tillväxt med intresse för affärsutveckling


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
* En unik utvecklingsmiljö och Sveriges bästa kundlista.
* Tillgång till vårt internationella nätverk för inspiration och vidareutbildning.
* Samarbete med Sveriges bästa kundteam och en oslagbar samling av Sveriges största annonsörer


**Om Carat & Dentsu**
 Carat ingår i Dentsu Sweden som är del i ett globalt kommunikationsnätverk med 47.000 medarbetare i fler än 145 länder. Vi erbjuder våra medarbetare möjligheten att jobba med flera marknadsledande varumärken och spännande kunder. Våra samtliga svenska bolag är miljödiplomerade enligt Svensk Miljöbas och vi jobbar aktivt med vårt sociala och miljömässiga ansvarstagande som arbetsgivare och medmänniskor. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion är djupt förankrat i våra gemensamma värderingar - the 8 Ways to Never Before – och vårt Leadership Framework är applicerbart på alla våra medarbetare. Vi är stolta över det som gör oss unika som företag och individer och vi uppmuntrar sökande från alla olika typer av bakgrunder att söka sig till oss.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder bland annat:**
* Kollektivavtal
* 5000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 dagars semesterrätt
* Flexibilitet och den bästa möjliga mixen av två goda ting, att jobba på våra kontor och att jobba hemma
* Många karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter


**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Låter det här som något för dig? Om du kan se dig själv i rollen som Client Director på Carat och som en del av dentsu-nätverket, vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan – vi är nyfikna på dig och vad just du kan bidra med! Vi kommer att påbörja urvalsprocessen, men på grund av sommar och ledigheter kommer aktiv selektering att ske i augusti. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Vid frågor, kontakta:**
 Maria K., Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com.
   

  

 Madeleine Jarehov, Managing Director Carat
   

  

 madeleine.jarehov@carat.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Carat
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Lead Software Architect
description:
Barnebys Group AB is the world’s leading ecosystem for art, antiques, and collectibles throughout the value chain. Founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2011, we have established our business globally with offices in the US, UK, France, Spain, and Germany. Our clients include the world’s top tier of auctioneers, antique dealers, galleries, as well as regional and local businesses. We offer a search service with over 600,000 items for sale, an extensive database of auction results, a top-of-the-line valuation service, and a white-label auction and gallery system. We are committed to making antiques and collectibles accessible to everyone. We are now looking to grow our business even further and are seeking top talent to join our team.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Lead Software Architect** 
 to design highly performant, scalable solutions for our SaaS applications and to guide our development teams in achieving technical excellence.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing:** 




  




* **Own and Drive Architecture:** 
 Take ownership of the architecture, ensuring proactive planning and design of high-performance solutions that enable and support our business objectives.
* **Active Coding:** 
 Be actively involved in writing, reviewing, and optimising code alongside the team to ensure high standards and best practices.
* **Leadership:** 
 Act as a technical mentor and coach, guiding teams in writing high-quality, testable code, and fostering a culture of excellence.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work within a cross-functional team to deliver premium experiences to our users and experts globally.
* **Agile Processes:** 
 Promote and reinforce the importance of agile processes within the team, ensuring smooth and efficient workflow.
* **Backend Development:** 
 Design, develop, and deploy backend services focusing on high availability, low latency, and scalability.
* **Innovation and Improvement:** 
 Continuously monitor, test, and optimise designs to ensure the highest standards of performance and reliability.
* **Strategic Advisor:** 
 Act as a sounding board providing strategic insights to ensure cohesive and comprehensive solutions across the organisation.



  





**Who You Are:** 




  




* **Experienced and Knowledgeable:** 
 Proven experience with cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS, and Azure, and a deep understanding of databases and architectural patterns. You have a track record of building multi-tenant systems.
* **Full-Stack Awareness:** 
 You have a strong understanding of frontend technologies like React and Next.js, enabling you to ensure seamless integration and collaboration between backend and frontend development.
* **Excellent Communicator:** 
 Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly.
* **Curious and Open-Minded:** 
 Open to different perspectives, leading with curiosity, humility, and a strong coaching mindset.
* **Business-Savvy:** 
 Understand the importance of your work in providing value to others and appreciate the balance between technical and business decisions.
* **Agile Understanding:** 
 You have a good understanding of the principles of flow optimization, relative estimation, and reflective practices within agile frameworks, and recognize their importance in improving team efficiency and product quality.
* **Team Player:** 
 Recognize the strength of a well-communicated, self-organised team in an agile environment.
* **Domain Experience:** 
 Experience in the auction or e-commerce domain is a plus.
* **Sound Engineering Practices:** 
 Passionate about sound engineering practices and continuously improving your skills.



  





**Bonus:** 



* Knowledge about finance and accounting systems



  





 We will start reviewing all applications after August 5th

title: System Design Engineer - Vehicle Components
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.  

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.  

We are looking for a System Design Engineer with broad knowledge of vehicle systems that can lead the SW and Electrical System Integration of our electrical base vehicle, ensuring that the interface between the autonomous driving system and the base vehicle is according to requirements.  

At Einride everyone is responsible for their work end to end, from development to production. You will help us improve developer happiness, our fearless development culture and acquire a deep understanding of your domain.
### **What you’ll do**

* Lead the work with defining the interfaces between our autonomous driving system and the base vehicle
* Lead and/or contribute in system design, software requirements and verifications for our base vehicle
* Lead roadmap work and concept design
* Support the Software developers in our Vehicle Controls and Actuation team by being the interface between them and suppliers
* Contribute in supplier evaluation and nomination for key subsystems such as Battery, steering, braking and propulsion systems

### **What we’re looking for**

* Be either a strong technical project manager who likes to contribute in system engineering OR a System Engineer with strong ability to communicate to stakeholders
* Have at least 5 years experience within System or SW development
* Be interested in growing technical competence within electrical vehicle engineering
* Communicate well in english
* M.sc in relevant field (e.g. computer science, embedded systems, vehicle engineering, electrical engineering or similar)

### **Bonus skills**

* Automotive industry experience
* Electromobility systems
* Development of safety critical systems
* Agile development
* System safety (ISO 26262)
* Automotive communication technology and protocols (CAN, J1939 etc)


This position is based in Gothenburg. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.  

During July and August response time will be longer and processes will to some extent be on hold for a few weeks due to the vacation season in Sweden. You can expect for us to get back to you on your application in August.  

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.  

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Senior Engineer in R&D
description:
Stockholm On-site
  
  

Robots have long been the subjects of our dreams, inspiring us to look towards the future. Here at Furhat Robotics, we’re working to create that future today. Do you like working with bleeding edge technology? Do you like pulling different technologies together to redefine the state of the possible? If so, you might be a fit for our team. Today, we’re looking for a senior engineer with a focus on software to join our R&D team.
  
  

The mission of our R&D team is to quickly experiment with new technologies, integrating them into our robots, designing new experiences, or creating novel new products. This team isn’t building production software, but rather finding new ways to use our products to create innovative solutions. To be successful, you'll need to be as creative as you are technical. Working with a tight knit team of experts, you'll be picking up new technology and prototyping new, fun, and interesting experiences.
  
  

Skills & Requirements
  
  

Required Skills & Experience
  
  

At least seven years of professional, real world experience as a software developer
  
  

At least three years of experience using Java or Kotlin
  
  

Reasonable proficiency with dynamic programming languages like Python or JavaScript
  
  

Strong orientation on finding demonstrable solutions to problems
  
  

Reasonable proficiency with electrical and mechanical design
  
  

Reasonable proficiency reading and comparing data sheets for things like sensors, servos, cameras, etc
  
  

Familiarity with languages other C-type languages, like C, C++ or C#
  
  

Experience with human interaction design through GUIs, robot interactions, video games, digital characters, avatars, or VR
  
  

Proficiency with source control systems (specifically git)
  
  

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  
  

Desire to work in a fast paced environment
  
  

Nice to Have Skills
  
  

Familiarity with neural networks or statistical machine learning
  
  

Familiarity with chatbots, linguistics, or conversational systems
  
  

Familiarity working in distributed systems
  
  

Familiarity working with desktop-type applications, ideally running on Linux
  
  

Experience working with, building, or developing for robots or automated systems
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Flexible hours
  
  

Competitive option package
  
  

Paid vacation & parental leave
  
  

Monthly workout grants
  
  

Personal health insurance & life insurance
  
  

Free beverages, snacks, team ginger shots
  
  

Choose your own tech gear
  
  

Located at Södermalm, close to Södra Station
  
  

Friday breakfast
  
  

Team building. Game nights, AWs, cook-offs etc.
  
  

Easily accessible for commuters
  
  

Work with the coolest technology around
  
  

About the company
  
  

We are an artificial intelligence and social robotics startup with the vision to make interaction with technology truly human. Founded by four PhDs in social robotics at KTH, we are an ambitious small team of scientists, engineers, and entrepreneurs backed by prominent investors. Our product is the most expressive and customizable social robot on the market. It is powered by a state-of-the-art multi-modal conversational platform and a developer suite used by 3rd party developers to build robot applications. We are looking for high-achievers that share our passion and wants to join our ride.
  
  

Kim Johansson | Contact Person

title: Test Engineer
description:
**Test engineer for Power Electronics lab**

  


**We aim high. So do you.**


At Volvo Cars, we have bold targets when it comes to innovation, sales and customer experience, and we’re developing new technologies to lead in safety, autonomous driving and electrification. If you want to grow together with talented people creating a new automotive future, we have a job for you.

  


**What do we offer?**  

Power Electronics lab is Volvo Cars’ Centre for testing of Inverters and Electrical Machines. To meet the future, we need to utilize state of the art methods to test and verify next generation Inverters and Electrical machines in an efficient and correct manner. Do you want to work as a test engineer in complex test environment that consist of engine emulator, battery simulators, dynos, HiL and high technology measurement system that can be fully automated? Then the role as Test Engineer for Power Electronics Labs is the place for you to prosper. The work requires both practical and theoretical skills. Your work consists of software preparation of testing, test automation, run the test, processing- and handling of measurement data and rig project initiation and -participation.  



**What you’ll do**


You will manage Test and verification activities. You will be responsible for development, maintenance and implementation of new features and methods in our propulsion test cells. You will be responsible for test rigs and equipment and secure that they are maintained. You will conduct problem solving investigations when required. You will answer questions from users regarding the labs capability and plan and manage verification activities.  

 You will develop your competence by participating in development and specification of test methods and usage of new test equipment and SW. In this role you can build a broad network within R&D and the Laboratory.  

Required Skills & Experience  

* M.Sc. or B.Sc. Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering or equivalent experience
* Experience from HW verification or test method development
* Experience from embedded programming, C, python and interface design
* Knowledge in ethernet, CAN protocols and measurement devices
* Knowledge of fault tracing complex system consisting of HW and SW
* Experience of programming in a Test Automation System is highly meritorious.

…but Personality & Potential are Key  

You are comfortable making your own decisions and appreciate the freedom to take required actions on own initiative. You have an analytical- and solution-based mindset, that empower your ability to draw technical conclusions out of complex systems. You improve structure and process as a natural part of your work. You are cooperative by nature and bring out the best in others. You possess strong communications skills, a genuine interest in technology and are driven by constantly learning and improving, both yourself and your scope.

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**


Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Technical Lead Engineer - Battery Cell Group
description:
**Innovation starts with being curious.**


At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?

  


**About us**


Volvo Cars is leading the transformation towards a sustainable future with a series of new, electrified vehicles across a range of platforms. By 2030, we aim to be leading in electrification and sustainability; with a goal of half of all Volvo cars sold being fully electric. To deliver upon this vision, we need to master cell technology to fully understand how the battery cell design and materials influence the cell attributes' performance, safety, durability, sustainability, quality, and cost.


Our well-established Battery Department is at the heart of these efforts. Through cross-functional collaboration, we're pushing the boundaries of battery engineering development. Our teams ensure we deliver high-quality, cutting-edge electric vehicles to our customers on time, every time.

  


**What´s in it for you?**


You will work within the battery cell design group, alongside a dynamic, international team with a broad range of experts. You will be part of a stimulating and creative workplace ensuring excellent battery cell solutions for Volvo’s next-generation sustainable cars.


You will have a technical leading role in an industry undergoing exciting transformations. Your contributions will influence both Volvo Cars and the broader environmental landscape.


If you are seeking exciting opportunities for constant personal and professional growth; as well as solving new challenges that arise within the fast-evolving electrification sector; then Volvo Cars Cell Design Group is the right place for you.

  


As a part of your role at Volvo Cars, your responsibilities will cover:


* **Leading Cell Technical Development:** Leading the development of cutting-edge battery cell technology from initial concept to full-scale industrialization.


* **Drive Project Deliveries and Success:** Take the lead on cell technical deliveries during crucial concept phases, ensuring alignment with Volvo's vision for sustainable mobility.


* **Coordinating Cell Sourcing:** Collaborate with system architects and procurement teams to optimize our cell sourcing strategy, balancing cell design, attributes, and cost.


* **Define Cell Specification:** Work closely with system and product teams to transform high-level vehicle requirements into precise cell specifications, bridging the gap between vehicle performance and battery technology.


* **Foster Supplier Partnerships:** Build and maintain strong relationships with cell suppliers, guiding the design, evaluation, and validation processes to meet Volvo's standards.


* **Enable Next-Gen Software Integration:** Function as a link between battery CAE and software teams, using your deep cell knowledge to support the development of advanced control algorithms and diagnostics for Volvo Cars’ software-defined vehicles.


* **Pioneer Testing Methodologies:** Design and implement innovative test methods and procedures at Volvo's state-of-the-art Battery Lab facilities, evaluating new cell chemistries, designs, and sub-system integrations.


* **Drive Continuous Improvement:** Analyze test results and market trends to recommend enhancements to cell technology, ensuring Volvo remains at the forefront of electric vehicle innovation.


* **Cross-functional leadership:** Collaborate across departments to ensure seamless integration of battery technology into Volvo's broader vehicle architecture.

  


**You and your skills:**


We are looking for a collaborative team member, who shares our passion for evolving battery cell technologies, automotive engineering, and sustainability. Within this strategically important technology area, you can work independently, initiate improvements and prioritize tasks effectively to secure your project deliveries and investigations.


To thrive in this role, you will need to collaborate and coordinate teams across the Volvo Cars battery department and beyond. It is expected that you will develop your knowledge and skills in automotive engineering practices and processes, while at the same time, mentoring individuals, and teams on the relevant aspects of cell technology and development. You are an effective communicator of complex technical concepts towards external and internal stakeholders, and you are committed to ethical and sustainable practices with our suppliers.


For us, it is important that you are eager to share knowledge and ideas on cell technology to ensure we are leading the sustainable energy transformation.

  


To fulfil your responsibilities at Volvo Cars, we believe that your background includes the following:


* MSc or PhD in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or related fields.


* Minimum 5 years’ experience in battery cell development preferably with a cell producer or automotive OEM.


* Deep understanding of electrochemical properties, and characterization techniques (ex. EIS, ICA, CV, GITT)


* Experience of modern cell design principles, cell components and their interactions within the cell.


* Comprehensive knowledge of battery cell development trends and an ability to perform cell technology analyses.

  


This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of electric vehicle innovation, combining your technical expertise with Volvo's commitment to sustainability. If you're ready to drive the future of mobility and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!


Are you our next battery technology leader? Apply now and help us shape the future of sustainable transportation!

  


**Who are we?**


Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

  

  

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Information Systems Security Engineer
description:
Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.

  

Your role


As an Information Systems Security Engineer on Kockums you will be working with information systems security in our submarine and surface ship projects. You will work closely with our IT Architects and system engineering teams, to make sure information onboard our submarines and surface ships are secure from unauthorized access, manipulation, destruction etc.  

Our products consist of many systems, both developed in house and procured and integrated in a complex distributed environment.

  

The main tasks are:

* Information systems security requirement identification, analysis and verification
* Supporting IT architects and system engineers in the product development process
* Review and analysis of technical security solutions
* Information security analysis e.g. vulnerability analysis and risk management
* Create security documentation e.g. descriptions, instructions and policies


You will work from either one of our centrally located and coastal offices in Malmö or Karlskrona. The work may involve some business travel, both within Sweden and abroad.


Your profile


We are looking for a person with great communicative skills to collaborate with many different stakeholders in our cross functional environment. You have the knowledge to convert requirements and analysis into technical solutions. We are looking for a great colleague that will fit into our group of open minded individuals constantly sharing our knowledge and experience!  

Who you are is of great value for us in our selection process. So straight out of school or with experience, you might be the one for us.

  

Required skills:  

* A university degree or equivalent experiences in IT, engineering, software or similar areas
* Knowledge and experience in information security
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, verbal and written


Desired skills:  

* Knowledge and experience from working with information security standards and processes
* Experience from working with product development
  

This position requires that you will be approved in a security screening in accordance with the Swedish Protective Security Act.


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

  

If you have any questions about the job, don´t hesitate to contact  

Mattias Bruzelius, recruiting manager +46 734 18 87 49


Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. You can send us your application in either Swedish or English.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: E-mobility Engineer
description:
I am Oskar, your potential next leader and a veteran in the context of Vasaloppet, 11, and still going strong! For me, engineering has been the most interesting when I have had projects and problems to solve with all the different parts of a product. I love to work in the area where software and hardware meet, and the most fun is when it contributes to a better society. You will enjoy being a part of my team if you like the freedom to try new assignments and technologies and want to create products. My leadership style is to help you grow in the pace and direction that you would like. That is also why I chose to join Knightec from the beginning!

**Why working as a consultant will fit you**
--------------------------------------------


Because you want to focus on solving technical problems without internal politics, you want to make new products that last, not handling the old legacy. And you want to have a team with engineers who understand the problem you meet and help you see them from another perspective.

**What will you work with?**
----------------------------


For the transportation sector, electrification is the paradigm shift of the century. As an engineer within e-Mobility at Knightec, you could drive the change.


The required areas of expertise within electromobility cover a broad spectrum, and where you want to contribute is up to you. Whether you are skilled in Systems engineering, Embedded software development, Control systems design, or Test and verification, your knowledge will be valuable.


We believe that a holistic approach is required to make products and services succeed both now and in the future. Our way of working is in cross-functional teams closely collaborating with our customers.

**What you need to bring**
--------------------------


Our best guess is that you have an educational background in mechatronics, electronics, computer science, or software engineering with an interest in electrification and/or the automotive industry.


Electrification consist of a variety of building blocks, and we think you have competence and experience from one or several of the following:

* *Electric motors*
* *Inverters*
* *Battery technology*
* *Battery Management Systems*
* *Charging*

More specifically, we are looking for skilled people whose key competencies lie within any of the following fields:

* *Systems Engineering*
* *Embedded software development (Matlab Simulink, C, C++)*
* *Electronics design*
* *Control systems design*
* *Test and verification*

**Knightec**
------------


We are consultants in technology, digitalization, and leadership. We work to improve people's lives through game-changing solutions. We are engineers focusing on product development that should be sustainable and durable in edge technology in both in-house projects and at customer sites. We are more than 900 engineers in 10 different cities. To be a consultant at Knightec isn't just a job; it is the way to build a career that you can be proud of!

title: Group Manager E-Drive & Energy Systems
description:
**Group Manager E-Drive & Energy Systems**
==========================================

  

We are looking for a driven and outgoing manager to lead one of our growing engineering teams. The position is a fun mix of sales and engineering. The work is fast paced, customer focused and offers a high degree of freedom and autonomy. If you have an engineering background with proven leadership qualities and you want to take on more responsibility, this could be the position for you! Here you get a chance to be part of a sharp management team that has fun together in an open and positive atmosphere. You will also work closely with our customers in the Swedish automotive community as well as the sales organization and your peers in the AVL global network. The electrification team in Sweden consists of highly skilled engineers in battery and e-drive development. The work of the team is performed both in-house in our own facilities and at customer locations. At AVL Sweden, we have the drive, speed and flexibility of a smaller company combined with the resources and expert knowhow of a large organization!

  


**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  


* Full responsibility for the engineering team – leading and developing the team, recruitment, business development, sales and marketing of group services, budget, planning, staff liability and final sign-off on technical deliverables
* At AVL, each engineering team is a profit center with growth and revenue goals. For the manager there is a lot of freedom to build the team, market and develop services
* Together with the Swedish management develop and manage the portfolio that AVL in Sweden offer to the market
* Define new projects and solutions in cooperation with customers

  





**YOUR PROFILE:**

  


* Master’s degree in engineering or similar
* Proven experience in technical sales and customer communication
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in the automotive industry or similar, preferably in leadership positions
* Enjoys customer relationships and has good business skills.
* Team player with good social skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Meriting with experience in automotive electrification
* Meriting with experience in service provider sales

  





**WE OFFER:**

  


* Be part of our pioneering work– together with our customers we shape the future of mobility!
* Competitive Compensation Package
* Collective Agreement and insurances
* A stimulating work environment and a company culture where results, curiosity, learning, and customer focus are key
* An attractive mix of freedom and responsibility
* Fast pace and short routes for decision making.
* A world class back-office containing everything worth knowing about energy and automotive development
* An international environment with many opportunities to network with our colleagues around the globe

  





**Interested?**  

If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL!


For further information please contact Jonas Modin, Manager Engineering East, jonas.modin@avl.com. We look forward to receiving your details!

  


Due to holidays during summer, the recruitment process may take longer than normal. Thanks in advance for your patience.


**About AVL**
-------------


AVL is one of the world’s leading mobility technology companies for development, simulation and testing in the automotive industry, and beyond. We provide concepts, solutions and methodologies in fields like vehicle development and integration, e-mobility, automated and connected mobility (ADAS/AD), and software for a greener, safer, better world of mobility.
